                        if( serviceID != 0 ){

                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;

            /* check for whitelists once per day */

                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>
</div>

<script src="https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/harrisondaily.com/shared-content/art/tncms/templates/libraries/flex/components/plugins/resources/scripts/jquery.calendario.7b513d925fce875220017f8d5a8055a0.js"></script>
<script>/*<![CDATA[*/ jQuery(document).ready(function($){
        var aChecked = [],
            urlParams = '/search/?l=25&unrolled=1&s=start_time&sd=asc&f=html',

            $wrapper = $( '#block-1484449 .fc-inner' ),
            $calendar = $( '#calendar-1484449' ),
            cal = $calendar.calendario({
                displayWeekAbbr: true,
                startIn: 0,
                onDayClick: function( $el, $contentEl, dateProperties ) {
                    window.location = $('#block-1484449 .url-template').attr('href') + urlParams + '&d1=' + $el.find('.fc-date').data('date') + '&d2=' + $el.find('.fc-date').data('date');
                }
            }),
            $month = $( '#block-1484449 .fc-month' ).html( cal.getMonthName() ),
            $year = $( '#block-1484449 .fc-year' ).html( cal.getYear() );


        $('#block-1484449 .fc-next').on('click', function() {
            cal.gotoNextMonth(updateMonthYear);
        });
        $('#block-1484449 .fc-prev').on('click', function() {
            cal.gotoPreviousMonth(updateMonthYear);
        });
        function updateMonthYear(){
            $month.html(cal.getMonthName());
            $year.html(cal.getYear());
            fetchDays();
        }
        function fetchDays(){
            if( aChecked.indexOf(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth()) == -1 ){
                $.ajax({
                    type: 'GET',
                    dataType: 'json',
                    url: $('#block-1484449 .url-template').attr('href') + '/search/?year='+cal.getYear()+'&month='+cal.getMonth()+'&fmt=json',
                    cache: true,
                    success: function(data) {
                        $.each(data, function(index, value){
                            if(value.result.numEvents > 0){
                                sMonth = value.result.month.toString();
                                if(sMonth.length < 2){ sMonth = '0'+sMonth }
                                sDay = value.result.day.toString();
                                if(sDay.length < 2){ sDay = '0'+sDay }
                                sString = sMonth + '-' + sDay + '-' + value.result.year;

                                oNumEvents = {};

                                var iOneDot = 1,
                                    iTwoDots = 2,
                                    iThreeDots = 3;

                                oNumEvents[sString] = '<div class="fc-data-item">';
                                if( value.result.numEvents > 0 && value.result.numEvents < iOneDot+1 ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> ';
                                }else if( value.result.numEvents > iOneDot && value.result.numEvents < iTwoDots+1 ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i>';
                                }else if( value.result.numEvents > iTwoDots ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i>';
                                }
                                oNumEvents[sString] += '</div>';

                                cal.setData(oNumEvents);
                            }
                        });

                        if( aChecked.indexOf(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth()) == -1 ){
                            aChecked.push(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth());
                        }
                    },
                    error: function(response) {
                        __tnt.log(response.status);
                    }
                });
            }
        }
        fetchDays();
    }); /*]]>*/</script>

Cairo, Ill. boil water order lifted

The city was under an order since Sunday because of low water levels.

  • Related LinksMore>>

  • Water service restored to Cairo residents

    Water service restored to Cairo residents

    Many are reporting little to no water pressure Sunday morning in Cairo due to water system problems and low Ohio River levels.  Because of those water problems, there will be no school on Monday.
    Illinois American Water has restored water service to customers in its Cairo District. But, a boil water order is in effect for customers in the Cairo service area due to a temporary interruption in water service.
CAIRO, IL (KFVS) -

City leaders lifted a boil water order in Cairo, IL Wednesday morning.

The city was under an order since Sunday because of low water levels.

The issue also canceled class in Cairo on Monday.

Crews with Illinois American Water worked overtime to fix the problem.

Officials say they discovered low water levels in the Ohio river.

Mechanical issues also affected water intake between the river and the plant.

</div><div id="Position_1_Ad" style="margin-top:25px;"><script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('Position_1_Ad'); });</script></div><div class="td-main-content-wrap td-container-wrap">
<div class="td-container td-post-template-default ">
<div class="td-crumb-container"></div>
<div class="td-pb-row">
<div class="td-pb-span8 td-main-content" role="main">
<div class="td-ss-main-content">
<article class="post-1266093 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-river-valley tag-maine tag-peru" id="post-1266093" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article">
<div class="td-post-header">
<header class="td-post-title">
<h1 class="entry-title">Peru spring contaminated; boil-water notice posted</h1>
<div class="td-module-meta-info">
<div class="td-post-author-name"><div class="td-author-by">By</div> <b>
                    Sun Journal  
                    <div class="td-author-line"> - </div> </b></div>
<span class="td-post-date"><time class="entry-date updated td-module-date" datetime="2012-10-16T04:00:00+00:00">October 16, 2012</time></span> <div class="td-post-comments"><a href="http://www.sunjournal.com/peru-spring-contaminated-boil-water-notice-posted/#respond"><i class="td-icon-comments"></i>0</a></div> </div>
</header>
</div>
<div class="td-post-content">
<div class="p402_premium">
<div class="at-above-post addthis_tool" data-url="http://www.sunjournal.com/peru-spring-contaminated-boil-water-notice-posted/"></div><p>PERU — The public spring on Greenwoods Road has been posted to alert people to boil the water because it is contaminated, town officials advised this week.</p>
<p>The town put a sign at the spring after the state advised testing showed there was E. coli and coliform bacteria in the water, Tim Holland, chairman of the Board of Selectmen said Tuesday.</p>
<p>Resident Warren Oldman said surface water is seeping into the tiled well because the tiles are not properly sealed.</p>
<p>Hundreds of people use the spring water, Holland said.</p>
<div class="td-a-rec td-a-rec-id-content_inline td_uid_2_5a27e99b5559c_rand td_block_template_1"><!-- /6119/smg/sunjournal.com -->
<div class="td-adspot-title">Advertisement</div><div id="inline1_ad" style="padding: 0 0 10px;">
<script>
googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('inline1_ad'); });
</script>
</div></div><p>Selectman Kathy Hussey said the spring water has been tested, but there must be tests for three consecutive weeks with negative results before she can remove the boil water notice.</p>
<p>Selectmen on Monday scheduled a review of the wind power ordinance for 6 p.m. Monday, Oct. 29. Selectmen will meet an hour earlier at the Peru Elementary School.</p>
<p>The Peru Industrial Wind Power Committee drafted the ordinance after EDP Renewables North America LLC of Houston, Texas, received a permit in October 2011 to place a meteorological test tower off Black Mountain Road near the Sumner town line. The company is considering building possibly 25 to 35 turbines, a representative told the committee this year.</p>
<p>The town has a moratorium on such projects and it expires in May 2013.</p>
<p>Selectman Dickie Powell said it was a mistake to go forward with the ordinance, but Holland said it is time to let the people decide.</p>
<p>Lien notices are being mailed to property owners who owe three or more years of taxes. Town Clerk Vera Parent said one person has paid their bill and she is working with several others on payment. If taxes are not paid by a certain time, the town can take the property.</p>
<p>The board approved an application from Danny Brown of Dickvale Road for a shed.</p>

<script>
var DDO = DDO || {};

/*<!-- begin metrics_dtm_library_override block -->
	DDO.DTMLibraryURL = '//assets.adobedtm.com/20d5deb47c9e7fe47a9f969db01578a739d7179d/satelliteLib-957c807c04889420ee4275af28c6c2db85a6b0d8.js'; 
<!-- end metrics_dtm_library_override block -->*/


DDO.hasLocalStorage = function(){
	return typeof(localStorage) != "undefined" && localStorage.setItem("test","test") &&
		localStorage.getItem("test") && localStorage.removeItem("test");
}
</script>
<script src="//www.whio.com/r//PortalConfig/common/metrics/js/dtm-ddo-utilities.js"></script>
<script>
DDO.init = function(pubsub, dependentEvents) {
	// 	SITE DATA
	
	DDO.siteData = {
		siteID: 'whio-tv',
	    siteDomain: 'www.whio.com',
	    siteVersion: 'responsive site',
	    siteFormat: 'tv',
	    siteMetro: 'oh: dayton',
	    siteMedium: 'tv',
	    siteType: 'superbrand',
	    siteCMS: 'methode'
	};
    // PAGE DATA
	var isDwp = false;
	console.log("isDwp: ", isDwp);
	var isHome = isDwp && false;
	console.log("page Title:" + 'Water boil advisory for Wright State ends');
	var trimPageNameUrl = removeExtracharFromUrl('/news/local/water-boil-advisory-for-wright-state-ends/70nvWrHYeEeGrzLhZBqV8M/');
	
	DDO.pageData = {
		pageFlow : "",
		pageNumber : '1',
		pageType : 'infinite scroll',
		pageIsDwp: isDwp // Necessary for bookmarklet purposes.
	};
	if(isDwp) {
	    DDO.pageData.pageContentType = (isHome) ? 'homepage' : 'section front';
		DDO.pageData.pageMainSection = (isHome) ? '/'+'homepage' : '/news/local/water-boil-advisory-for-wright-state-ends/70nvWrHYeEeGrzLhZBqV8M/';
		DDO.pageData.pageName = (isHome) ? '/' + 'homepage' + '/' : '/news/local/water-boil-advisory-for-wright-state-ends/70nvWrHYeEeGrzLhZBqV8M/';
	} else {
	    DDO.pageData.pageContentType = 'article';
		DDO.pageData.pageMainSection ='/news/local';
		DDO.pageData.pageName = trimPageNameUrl;
	}
	
	DDO.pageData.pageTitle = 'Water boil advisory for Wright State ends';
	DDO.pageData.pageSiteSection = (isHome) ? 'home' : 'News';
	 
	if (DDO.pageData.pageContentType == '') {
		var pageName = DDO.pageData.pageName;
		var pageNameSplit = pageName.split('/');
		DDO.pageData.pageContentType = pageNameSplit[1];
	} 
	
	DDO.pageData.pageCategory = 'Local';
	if (DDO.pageData.pageCategory == 'Error') {
		DDO.pageData.pageContentType = "Page not found";
	}
	DDO.pageData.pageSubCategory = '';
	
	// CONTENT DATA (contentViewType is set in access meter metrics)
	DDO.contentData = DDO.contentData || {};
	var contentTopics ='';
	
	DDO.contentData.contentTopics = contentTopics;
	var contentByline = '';
	
	DDO.contentData.contentByline = contentByline + " " + 'www.whiotv.com';
	
	DDO.contentData.contentOriginatingSite =  'cmgoldcontent';
	DDO.contentData.contentID = 'aa43b767-4903-4577-8f01-f55b45ecfdb7';
	DDO.contentData.contentVendor = '';
	DDO.contentData.contentViewType = DDO.contentData.contentViewType || '';
	DDO.contentData.contentPublishDate = '20121016235909';
	DDO.contentData.blogName = '';
	DDO.contentData.galleryName = '';
	var pageSubContentType = '';
	if(pageSubContentType == 'Post') {
		DDO.contentData.blogName = 'Water boil advisory for Wright State ends';
	}else if(DDO.pageData.pageContentType == 'gallery') {
		DDO.contentData.galleryName = 'Water boil advisory for Wright State ends';
	}
	
	//We need to set this one only for imported stories.
	DDO.contentData.contentOriginatingCMS='Medley';
	DDO.contentData.contentOriginatingID='1504955';
	DDO.contentData.melvilID='news.medleystory.1504955';
	
	//SEARCH DATA PAGE CONTENT
	
		
   
  
   DDO.pageData.pageNumber = location.search.split('page=')[1] ? location.search.split('page=')[1] : location.search.split('offset=')[1] ? location.search.split('offset=')[1] : '1';
   
<!-- begin metrics_elements_override block -->


<!-- end metrics_elements_override block -->	
	
	// The following code defers loading the DTM library until after certain events have been fired,
	// namely janrain, mg2, and access meter.
	// Note: we need to add access meter to list of dependent events etc!
	DDO.dependentEvents = dependentEvents;// e.g. ['authn', 'authz'];
	  setTimeout(function(){
		DDO.dependentEventCheck("TIMED OUT");
	}, 10000); 
	if(dependentEvents.length == 0){
		DDO.utilities.triggerDTMPageView();//DDO.utilities.loadDTMLibrary();
	}
	
	pubsub.publish("DDO-initialized");
	console.log('DDO: ', DDO);

}

//Function to remove last alphanumeric chars from DDO.pageData.pageName url
function removeExtracharFromUrl(urlPath){
    var urlArr = urlPath.split('/');
    if (urlArr.length > 3) {
    	var urlArr_new = [];
		for (var i=0; i<urlArr.length-2;i++) {
			urlArr_new.push(urlArr[i]);
		}
		return urlArr_new.join('/') + '/';
    } 
    else {
    	return urlPath;	
    }
}
</script>
<!-- end metrics_complete_override block -->
<script>
DDO.authn = {
	init: function(pubsub, $){
		var hasLocalStorage = DDO.hasLocalStorage();
		DDO.userData = DDO.userData || {};
		if(hasLocalStorage){
			DDO.userData.userStatus = localStorage.getItem("metricsUserStatus")||"";
			DDO.userData.userActive = localStorage.getItem("metricsUserActive")||"";
			DDO.userData.userType = localStorage.getItem("metricsUserType")||"";
			if(localStorage.getItem("janrainCaptureReturnExperienceData")){
				DDO.userData.userProfileID = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem("janrainCaptureReturnExperienceData"))["uuid"] ||"";
			}
		}
		pubsub.subscribe("authn-login", function(event, data){
			DDO.userData.userStatus = 'registered';
			DDO.userData.userActive = 'logged-in';
			DDO.userData.userType = 'standard';
			if(hasLocalStorage){
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserStatus", DDO.userData.userStatus);
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserActive", DDO.userData.userActive);
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserType", DDO.userData.userType);
			}
			DDO.userData.userProfileID = data.uuid;
			DDO.dependentEventCheck('authn');
		});
		pubsub.subscribe("authn-anonymous", function(event, data){
			DDO.userData.userStatus = 'not registered';
			DDO.userData.userActive = 'not logged-in';
			DDO.userData.userType = 'anonymous';
			delete DDO.userData.userProfileID;
			if(hasLocalStorage){
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserStatus", DDO.userData.userStatus);
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserActive", DDO.userData.userActive);
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserType", DDO.userData.userType);
			}
			DDO.dependentEventCheck('authn');
			DDO.dependentEventCheck('authz');
		});
		pubsub.subscribe("authn-modal-open", function(event, data){
			if(typeof(window.janrainClickTracker)!="undefined"){
				if(typeof(DDO.loginEventClickNumber)!="undefined"){
					if(window.janrainClickTracker == DDO.loginEventClickNumber){
						return;
					}
				}
				DDO.loginEventClickNumber = window.janrainClickTracker;
			}
			DDO.action('loginEvent_start');
		});
 		pubsub.subscribe("login-complete", function(event, data){
			DDO.action('loginEvent_complete');
		});
		pubsub.subscribe("authn-logout", function(event, data){
			DDO.userData.userStatus = 'not registered';
			DDO.userData.userActive = 'not logged-in';
			DDO.userData.userType = 'anonymous';
			delete DDO.userData.userProfileID;
			if(hasLocalStorage){
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserStatus", DDO.userData.userStatus);
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserActive", DDO.userData.userActive);
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserType", DDO.userData.userType);
			}
			DDO.action('loginEvent_logout');
		});		
		// When user is auto-logged in.
		pubsub.subscribe("authn-login-return", function(event, data) {
			 DDO.action('loginEvent_return-user');
			 DDO.dependentEventCheck("authz");
		});
		pubsub.subscribe("registration-success", function(event, data) {
			DDO.action('loginEvent_new-user-register');
			
		});
		pubsub.subscribe("login-error", function(event, data) {
			DDO.action('loginEvent_error');
		});
	}
};
</script>
<script>
DDO.comment = {
	init: function(pubsub, $){
		pubsub.subscribe('comment-submit', function(event, data){
			DDO.action('commentSubmitted');
			// data should be like: {element:"[widget clicked]",action:"click"}
			DDO.action('interaction-click', data);
		});
		
		pubsub.subscribe('additional-comments', function(event, data){
			DDO.action('additionalComments', data);
		});
	}
};
</script>
<script>
DDO.gallery = {
	init: function(pubsub, $){
		pubsub.subscribe("gallery-secondary", function(event, data){
			DDO.action('gallerySecondaryPhotoView');
		});
		pubsub.subscribe("gallery-opened", function(event, data){
			DDO.action('galleryOpened');
		});
	}
};
</script>
<script>
DDO.interaction = {
	init: function(pubsub, $){
		// pubsubcutioner can use regex for event names, thus all interaction type events
		// can be listened to assuming the data is correct.
		pubsub.subscribe("site-interaction", function(event, data){
			// data should be like: {element:"[widget clicked]",action: "[button clicked]"}
			DDO.action(event, data);
		});
	}
};
</script>
<script>
DDO.breakingNews = {
	init: function(pubsub, $){
		pubsub.subscribe("breaking-news-banner", function(event, data){
			DDO.action("breakingNews", {contentType:DDO.pageData.pageContentType});
		});
		
		pubsub.subscribe("breaking-news-story", function(event, data){
			DDO.action('breakingNewsStory');
		});
	}
};
</script>
<script>
DDO.socialShare = {
	init: function(pubsub, $){
		pubsub.subscribe("authn-social-share", function(event, data){
			DDO.action("socialClick", data);			
		});
	}
};
</script><script>

		if (numSlides) {
			var parentDropdown = $('#swiper_790928').closest('.dropdown');
			
			
			$('#swiper_790928').show();
			$(parentDropdown).find('.dropdown-menu').fadeIn(0);
			var galleryTop = new Swiper("#swiper_790928 .swiper-container", {
				loop: true,

				numThumbsShowing = 3;

				}

			if (numSlides <= numThumbsShowing) {

				$('#swiper_790928').find('.next').remove();

			}
			while (numSlides < numThumbsShowing) {

				numThumbsShowing--;

	})

		$(document).ready(
			function() {
				var changeSpeed = 300
				var swiperName = ('breaking-news' == 'breaking-news') ? 'breakingNewsSwiper' : 'liveVideoSwiper';
				var swiperName = new Swiper('#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news .swiper-container', {
					loop : true,
					speed : 600,
					autoplay : 8000,
					direction : 'horizontal',
					slidesPerView : 1,
					paginationClickable: false,
					nextButton : '#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news .next',
					prevButton : '#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news .prev',
					onSlideChangeStart: function(event) {
						var currentSlide = parseInt($('#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news .swiper-slide-active').attr('data-swiper-slide-index'))
						$('#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news #current-slide').html(currentSlide + 1);
						
						$('#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news .prefix h2 span').fadeOut(changeSpeed).promise().done(function(){
							var thisPrefix = $('#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news .prefix h2').children().eq($('#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news .swiper-slide-active').attr('data-swiper-slide-index'));
							thisPrefix.fadeIn(changeSpeed)
						 });
					}
				});
				if(1 == 1){
					swiperName.lockSwipes();
				}
			});
	</script>

<h1 class="headline">
            Water boil advisory for Wright State ends
         </h1>
<p>
<strong>Published: </strong>Tuesday, October 16, 2012 @ 7:59 PM<br/>
<strong>Updated: </strong>Tuesday, October 16, 2012 @ 7:59 PM<br/>
<span class="bylines">
<strong>By: </strong>

					www.whiotv.com</span>
</p>
<div class="lead-image-container">
<!-- don't show anything -->
</div>
<div class="socialShareButtons">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="The boil advisory for Wright State University was lifted Tuesday afternoon, ending the restriction for water consumption or use on the main campus." data-janrain-title="Water boil advisory for Wright State ends " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/water-boil-advisory-for-wright-state-ends/70nvWrHYeEeGrzLhZBqV8M/"></div>
</div>
<div class="article-container">
<!-- ARTICLE TEXT -->
<p><span class="article-dateline">
<span class="date-line-city">FAIRBORN</span>
</span>
<span> — </span>The boil advisory for Wright State University was lifted Tuesday afternoon, ending the restriction for water consumption or use on the main campus.</p><p>A low water level in the campus’ water tower prompted the advisory, which began Sunday.</p><p>Twenty-seven of WSU’s 28 residence halls receive their water supply from the City of Fairborn’s system and were unaffected by the advisory, said Seth Bauguess, WSU spokesman.</p><div class="clearfix ">During the advisory, the university supplied clean drinking water to residents of Hamilton Hall, the one hall affected by the advisory.</div><div class="socialShareButtons" style="margin-top:10px;">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="The boil advisory for Wright State University was lifted Tuesday afternoon, ending the restriction for water consumption or use on the main campus." data-janrain-title="Water boil advisory for Wright State ends " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/water-boil-advisory-for-wright-state-ends/70nvWrHYeEeGrzLhZBqV8M/"></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="object-well" data-canonicalurl="http://www.whio.com/news/local/husted-bucks-gop-against-voter-photo-push/1szTm6BWbcT6I9qQdKQ10M/" id="o-21517544914">
<h1 class="headline">
            Husted bucks GOP, is against voter photo ID push
         </h1>
<p>
<strong>Published: </strong>Friday, April 08, 2011 @ 6:11 AM<br/>
<strong>Updated: </strong>Friday, April 08, 2011 @ 6:11 AM<br/>
<span class="bylines">
<strong>By: </strong>

					































	
		
	
	
	
the Associated Press		
					-
					www.newstalkradiowhio.com</span>
</p>
<div class="lead-image-container">
<!-- don't show anything -->
</div>
<div class="socialShareButtons">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) -- The official who oversees Ohio's elections says he doesn't agree with a measure proposed by some fellow Republicans to require voters to show photo IDs at the polls." data-janrain-title="Husted bucks GOP, is against voter photo ID push " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/husted-bucks-gop-against-voter-photo-push/1szTm6BWbcT6I9qQdKQ10M/"></div>
</div>
<div class="article-container">
<!-- ARTICLE TEXT -->
<p>COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) -- The official who oversees Ohio's elections says he doesn't agree with a measure proposed by some fellow Republicans to require voters to show photo IDs at the polls.    <br/><br/>Secretary of State John Husted tells The Columbus Dispatch on Thursday that he would not change current policy that allows voters to prove their identities with photo IDs or other documents, such as utility bills or paychecks.    <br/><br/>A bill approved by the Ohio House would require voters to show the photo ID before casting an in-person ballot. It is now being reviewed by the Senate.    <br/><br/>Husted instead proposes changes for voters casting early ballots or provisional ballots. He says those voters should be required to give their full Social Security numbers instead of the currently required last four digits.</p><div class="socialShareButtons" style="margin-top:10px;">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) -- The official who oversees Ohio's elections says he doesn't agree with a measure proposed by some fellow Republicans to require voters to show photo IDs at the polls." data-janrain-title="Husted bucks GOP, is against voter photo ID push " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/husted-bucks-gop-against-voter-photo-push/1szTm6BWbcT6I9qQdKQ10M/"></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="clearfix"></div><div id="taboola-story-1"></div>
<div class="cm-ad RP03 story-1" id="cm-ad-34657"></div>

<div class="object-well" data-canonicalurl="http://www.whio.com/news/local/new-restaurants-retail-shops-coming-oxford/O2c2TxfjLOdrYELXvfOUtM/" id="o-20545829235">
<h1 class="headline">
            New restaurants, retail shops coming to Oxford
         </h1>
<p>
<strong>Published: </strong>Friday, October 28, 2016 @ 2:25 PM<br/>
<strong>Updated: </strong>Saturday, October 29, 2016 @ 4:37 PM<br/>
<span class="bylines">
<strong>By: </strong>

					































	
		
	
	
	
Eric Schwartzberg		
					-
					Staff Writer</span>
</p>
<div class="lead-image-container">
<!-- don't show anything -->
</div>
<div class="socialShareButtons">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="New restaurants and retail shops are coming to a development on the former Walmart site in Oxford.Bishop Square — a 50,000-square-foot mixed use development at 419 Locust Street that currently includes 272 units of student housing — is adding Marco’s Pizza, Tim Hortons, a Sprint retail store and a bank." data-janrain-title="New restaurants, retail shops coming to Oxford " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/new-restaurants-retail-shops-coming-oxford/O2c2TxfjLOdrYELXvfOUtM/"></div>
</div>
<div class="article-container">
<!-- ARTICLE TEXT -->
<p><span class="article-dateline">
<span class="date-line-city">OXFORD</span>
</span>
<span> — </span>New restaurants and retail shops are coming to a development on the former Walmart site in Oxford.</p><p>Bishop Square — a 50,000-square-foot mixed use development at 419 Locust Street that currently includes 272 units of student housing — is adding Marco’s Pizza, Tim Hortons, a Sprint retail store and a bank.</p><p>“The final stage is important because we’ll be building the outlots that sit along Locust, which will serve as the front door to the whole project,” said Josh Rothstein, of Blue Ash-based OnSite Retail Group, which is handling marketing and leasing for the project. “The retailers and restaurants are excited to open their locations here because being across from Kroger, TJ Maxx and Dollar Tree provides tremendous exposure, great visibility and easy access to the shoppers already passing through this part of town.</p><p>“It’s also easily in walking distance to not only the concentration of Miami’s campus, but also the off-campus housing population,” Rothstein said.</p><p>Two other storefronts on the site are being are in the process of being leased, he said.</p><p>Existing Bishop Square tenants include Oxford Lane Library, Mercy Health - Orthopaedics and Sports Rehabilitation, Great Clips and Cloud 9 Vapor Lounge. A second-floor above some of those tenants includes office space.</p><p>Alan Kyger, Oxford’s economic development director, said the community is excited to see the Bishop Square project moving into its final phases.</p><p>“In 2005, when Walmart moved away from this site, the abandoned building that was left behind was a large eyesore for the Tollgate Business District, as well as for the whole community,” Kyger said. “Developer Robert Fiorita is to be commended in providing such a good-looking redevelopment project.</p><p>“The addition of these merchants will provide the citizens of Oxford additional shopping options. I expect each of these new businesses to be very successful in this new development.”</p><p>Marco’s Pizza has 700 stores in 35 states, doubling in size over the last five years and on track to 1,000 stores by the end of 2017, according to the company. Area locations include Middletown, Monroe, Hamilton and Liberty Twp. in Butler County.</p><div class="clearfix ">Tim Hortons has more than 4,400 locations in the United States, Canada and the Middle East. Area locations include Monroe, Springboro and Maineville in Warren County.</div><div class="socialShareButtons" style="margin-top:10px;">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="New restaurants and retail shops are coming to a development on the former Walmart site in Oxford.Bishop Square — a 50,000-square-foot mixed use development at 419 Locust Street that currently includes 272 units of student housing — is adding Marco’s Pizza, Tim Hortons, a Sprint retail store and a bank." data-janrain-title="New restaurants, retail shops coming to Oxford " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/new-restaurants-retail-shops-coming-oxford/O2c2TxfjLOdrYELXvfOUtM/"></div>
</div>

<div class="object-well" data-canonicalurl="http://www.whio.com/news/local/crash-victim-lived-fly-friend-says/uUNxNvSpaiUMvmdSjgqXcL/" id="o-21272365153">
<h1 class="headline">
            Crash victim lived to fly, friend says
         </h1>
<p>
<strong>Published: </strong>Saturday, June 09, 2012 @ 8:16 AM<br/>
<strong>Updated: </strong>Saturday, June 09, 2012 @ 8:16 AM<br/>
<span class="bylines">
<strong>By: </strong>

					www.whiotv.com</span>
</p>
<div class="lead-image-container">
<!-- don't show anything -->
</div>
<div class="socialShareButtons">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="A 73-year-old Bellbook man killed in a plane crash Saturday morning was an experienced pilot who had built four planes like the “experimental aircraft” he flew that day, according to his wife." data-janrain-title="Crash victim lived to fly, friend says " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/crash-victim-lived-fly-friend-says/uUNxNvSpaiUMvmdSjgqXcL/"></div>
</div>
<div class="article-container">
<!-- ARTICLE TEXT -->
<p><span class="article-dateline">
<span class="date-line-city">SPRING VALLEY TWP., Ohio</span>
</span>
<span> — </span>A 73-year-old Bellbook man killed in a plane crash Saturday morning was an experienced pilot who had built four planes like the “experimental aircraft” he flew that day, according to his wife.</p> <p>Roger Flower died in the 8 a.m. crash, said Sgt. Anthony Pearcy of the Ohio State Highway Patrol.</p> <p>“Some witnesses in the area did see the plane flying and the witnesses believe they did see something fall off the plane,” he said.</p> <p>Flying out of the Lewis A. Jackson Regional Airport in Greene County, the plane flown by Flower crashed about 100 yards from a house at 1856 Ohio 380. Debris from the crash spread about 300 feet and the plane had extensive damage.</p> <p>Flower was a naval aviator for 31 years who still loved to fly in his retirement, said Jan Flower, his wife of 50 years.</p> <p>“It was his life, ” she said. “He was flying a plane that he had built and flew out of Greene County Airport and was there every day and loved it.”</p> <p>After retiring from the Navy, he became a certified aviation engineer and began building his own aircraft, his wife said.</p> <p>“He knew what he was doing about building it and just loved it and wasn’t ready to give up airplanes, so he built them,” she said.</p> <p>Both natives of Ohio, Roger and Jan Flower have four sons and moved to Bellbrook eight years ago, when they were done traveling with the Navy.</p> <p>She described her husband as “a leader, totally confident. (He) could tackle anything, could build or fix anything, loved his children and his grandchildren, (and) loved serving in his church.”</p> <p>The OHSP is investigating the crash with the National Transportation Safety Board and the Greene County Sheriff’s Office.</p> <p>The plane was a fixed wing, single engine, experimental/homemade aircraft, according to the patrol.</p> <p>“According to the family members, it’s been flown before,” said Pearcy.</p> <p>There was no flight plan filed for the plane and the destination of the flight was unknown, Pearcy said.</p> <div class="clearfix ">“As unfortunate as this incident is, it is fortunate that no other people were involved,” Pearcy said.</div><div class="socialShareButtons" style="margin-top:10px;">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="A 73-year-old Bellbook man killed in a plane crash Saturday morning was an experienced pilot who had built four planes like the “experimental aircraft” he flew that day, according to his wife." data-janrain-title="Crash victim lived to fly, friend says " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/crash-victim-lived-fly-friend-says/uUNxNvSpaiUMvmdSjgqXcL/"></div>
</div>

<div class="object-well" data-canonicalurl="http://www.whio.com/news/local/arrest-made-slaying-businessman/5RVDnP0OiuWmckLdcFFQsM/" id="o-21278736243">
<h1 class="headline">
            Arrest made in slaying of businessman
         </h1>
<p>
<strong>Published: </strong>Wednesday, April 11, 2012 @ 7:44 PM<br/>
<strong>Updated: </strong>Wednesday, April 11, 2012 @ 7:44 PM<br/>
<span class="bylines">
<strong>By: </strong>

					































	
		
	
	
	
Katie Wedell		
					-
					Staff Writer</span>
</p>
<div class="lead-image-container">
<!-- don't show anything -->
</div>
<div class="socialShareButtons">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="Police have arrested a 20-year-old Dayton man in the slaying of a business owner found dead inside a burned out garage last week." data-janrain-title="Arrest made in slaying of businessman " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/arrest-made-slaying-businessman/5RVDnP0OiuWmckLdcFFQsM/"></div>
</div>
<div class="article-container">
<!-- ARTICLE TEXT -->
<p><span class="article-dateline">
<span class="date-line-city">DAYTON</span>
</span>
<span> — </span>Police have arrested a 20-year-old Dayton man in the slaying of a business owner found dead inside a burned out garage last week.</p> <p>Anthony Lamar Stargell Jr. was arrested Wednesday morning and is in the Montgomery County Jail pending the filing of an unclassified felony murder charge.</p> <p>Dayton Sgt. Dan Mauch said detectives believe Stargell shot and killed 54-year-old Tommy Nickles before setting a fire inside 838 S. Main St. on April 3.</p> <p>“The fire did not do the damage that the perpetrator expected,” Mauch said Wednesday afternoon. He said evidence collected inside the business and from Nickles’ stolen work van helped lead detectives to Stargell. The van was recovered by police late April 3 in the 400 block of Leland Avenue.</p> <p>A search warrant was executed at 2905 Oakridge Drive on Wednesday, where Stargell occasionally stays with family. He was taken into custody at about 11 a.m.</p> <p>Nickles, of Kettering, died from multiple gunshot wounds and was found in a garage where he ran Quality One Electrical Service. A Golden retriever that had been shot to death also was found in the building, police said.</p> <p>Nickles' family confirmed last week that he had been living in the building because of a recent divorce. They said they couldn’t fathom why someone would want to kill the father of two. </p> <p>“Tom was a good man, he was a good father,” said Gavin Whitt, Nickles’ godson.</p> <p>Mauch said Stargell and Nickles knew each other. He said police are investigating robbery as a possible motive or that Nickles possibly owed Stargell money.</p> <p>“It’s still an ongoing investigation,” he said. Police also are trying to locate several individuals who may have stolen property belonging to Nickles.</p> <p>According to court records, Stargell was convicted of robbery in February 2011 and sentenced to five years’ probation.</p> <p>His mother, Tonya Bailey, said her son recently got out of prison, but she doesn’t believe that he is responsible for Nickles’ death.</p> <p>“I don’t think that he did do it, but if he did do it he didn’t do it by himself,” she said.</p> <div class="clearfix ">She said Stargell wasn’t on South Main Street on the night Nickles was killed. “He was here,” she said at her mother’s house on Wednesday.</div><div class="socialShareButtons" style="margin-top:10px;">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="Police have arrested a 20-year-old Dayton man in the slaying of a business owner found dead inside a burned out garage last week." data-janrain-title="Arrest made in slaying of businessman " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/arrest-made-slaying-businessman/5RVDnP0OiuWmckLdcFFQsM/"></div>
</div>

Pike County Water District issues boil order

Posted:

Pike County, Ill. (WGEM) -- Officials from the Pike County Water District have reported a boil order for several water customers due to a water main break.

The order is for customers between Barry and County Highway 2, north of Route 106 and south of Interstate 72.

The boil order will remain in affect until Wednesday, Oct. 17 at noon.

Boil order issued for all of Buckley

Tue, 10/16/2012 - 9:55am | Will Brumleve
Facebook LikeGoogle Plus OneTweet Widget

BUCKLEY — The entire village of Buckley is under a boil order until further notice.

ERH Enterprises, a Westville-based company contracted to maintain and operate Buckley’s water system, issued the boil order about 10:30 a.m. Tuesday after a water main broke about 9 a.m.

“A large hole basically blew out of the side of the water main in front of the water plant,” said ERH’s Sean McBride. “We repaired a smaller leak there yesterday, and about 6 feet away from where the initial leak was repaired, it blew a larger hole out of the side of the main.”

ERH is working to repair the water main and hopes to have repairs completed by noon.

<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>Loyce Saling, superintendent of the St. Joe/Pindall/Gilbert Water Association, said a six-inch transmission line break has forced a boil-water order for residents on South Woolum Road, Baker Ford Road, Tomahawk Road to the church, Osbourne Road to Gilbert and Highway 374 East and West. Water should be boiled briskly for one minute before drinking or for food preparation.</p>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });

<script src="https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/harrisondaily.com/shared-content/art/tncms/templates/libraries/flex/components/plugins/resources/scripts/jquery.calendario.7b513d925fce875220017f8d5a8055a0.js"></script>
<script>/*<![CDATA[*/ jQuery(document).ready(function($){
        var aChecked = [],
            urlParams = '/search/?l=25&unrolled=1&s=start_time&sd=asc&f=html',

            $wrapper = $( '#block-1484449 .fc-inner' ),
            $calendar = $( '#calendar-1484449' ),
            cal = $calendar.calendario({
                displayWeekAbbr: true,
                startIn: 0,
                onDayClick: function( $el, $contentEl, dateProperties ) {
                    window.location = $('#block-1484449 .url-template').attr('href') + urlParams + '&d1=' + $el.find('.fc-date').data('date') + '&d2=' + $el.find('.fc-date').data('date');
                }
            }),
            $month = $( '#block-1484449 .fc-month' ).html( cal.getMonthName() ),
            $year = $( '#block-1484449 .fc-year' ).html( cal.getYear() );


        $('#block-1484449 .fc-next').on('click', function() {
            cal.gotoNextMonth(updateMonthYear);
        });
        $('#block-1484449 .fc-prev').on('click', function() {
            cal.gotoPreviousMonth(updateMonthYear);
        });
        function updateMonthYear(){
            $month.html(cal.getMonthName());
            $year.html(cal.getYear());
            fetchDays();
        }
        function fetchDays(){
            if( aChecked.indexOf(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth()) == -1 ){
                $.ajax({
                    type: 'GET',
                    dataType: 'json',
                    url: $('#block-1484449 .url-template').attr('href') + '/search/?year='+cal.getYear()+'&month='+cal.getMonth()+'&fmt=json',
                    cache: true,
                    success: function(data) {
                        $.each(data, function(index, value){
                            if(value.result.numEvents > 0){
                                sMonth = value.result.month.toString();
                                if(sMonth.length < 2){ sMonth = '0'+sMonth }
                                sDay = value.result.day.toString();
                                if(sDay.length < 2){ sDay = '0'+sDay }
                                sString = sMonth + '-' + sDay + '-' + value.result.year;

                                oNumEvents = {};

                                var iOneDot = 1,
                                    iTwoDots = 2,
                                    iThreeDots = 3;

                                oNumEvents[sString] = '<div class="fc-data-item">';
                                if( value.result.numEvents > 0 && value.result.numEvents < iOneDot+1 ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> ';
                                }else if( value.result.numEvents > iOneDot && value.result.numEvents < iTwoDots+1 ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i>';
                                }else if( value.result.numEvents > iTwoDots ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i>';
                                }
                                oNumEvents[sString] += '</div>';

                                cal.setData(oNumEvents);
                            }
                        });

                        if( aChecked.indexOf(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth()) == -1 ){
                            aChecked.push(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth());
                        }
                    },
                    error: function(response) {
                        __tnt.log(response.status);
                    }
                });
            }
        }
        fetchDays();
    }); /*]]>*/</script>

WSU advises water is OK to drink

0

breaking news

Woman critically injured in single-vehicle crash on Ohio 725; earlier police told us driver had died

WSU advises water is OK to drink

0
  • Meagan Pant
    • Staff Writer
3:07 p.m Tuesday, Oct. 16, 2012 News
0
FAIRBORN

A water boil advisory has been lifted at Wright State University as classes were held despite a power outage that disrupted the water supply.

Work crews determined a power failure on Sunday caused an on-campus water tower to lose its supply level.

The problem meant drinkable water was not available to most of the campus since Sunday, including to the Hamilton Hall dorm with about 320 residents, said university spokesman Seth Bauguess. The latest alert drew comments from some students frustrated by at least the fourth advisory issued this year, most of them related to a $3.5 million project to replace four-decade-old original underground water pipes throughout the campus.

“It’s so inconvenient,” said Hamilton Hall resident Jessica Redinbo.

The advisory was issued after the water level dropped in the tower, Bauguess said. The university has determined a loss of power to the pumps that supply the tower caused the problem, but the reason for the power failure remains unknown. He said the power failure is unrelated to the pipe replacement project, which was completed in August.

“Any time water pressure drops like that, you have to do a boil advisory,” Bauguess said.

None of WSU’s students were displaced and the university is providing bottled water to Hamilton Hall residents, Bauguess said. The university’s 27 other residence halls were not affected because they are served by Fairborn city water. Tests were being conducted Monday to determine when the boil advisory would be lifted, he said. Students and staff were alerted by text message to the advisory and signs were placed throughout campus.

Redinbo said she was upset by the disruption. “In the shower, you have to worry about a little water getting in your mouth. You have to put it in the microwave before you can cook with it. After the union closes, you don’t have anything to drink,” she said.

Junior Aileen Duckett said she circled campus looking for free water, since her off-campus residence is a 10-minute walk away and too far to visit during the day.

“I’m sure WSU’s drink sales are skyrocketing,” she said. “I’m sure the boil advisory isn’t their fault, but it sure feels like they’re profiting from it.”

Wright State closed campus for a day on Dec. 29 because of a ruptured pipe. Boil advisories were also issued in March when the university planned outages over spring break as part of the water pipe replacement project. Last month, a pipe burst at the Nutter Center that caused some damage and flooded classrooms and offices.

“There were issues that came from replacing tons and ton of pipe. And they were expected,” Bauguess said.

UPDATE: Boil order lifted in Walford

Posted:
WALFORD (KWWL) -

The Iowa Department of Natural Resources has lifted a boil order that was in place for a part of Walford for more than a week.

Water samples taken during routine testing in the Clover Ridge Subdivision in Walford earlier this month turned up positive for E. coli bacteria.  More samples taken on October 11 were free of E. Coli bacteria, but tested positive for total bacteria, forcing the DNR to issue the boil order on October 15.

The DNR says five samples taken on October 18 show the water supply is absent of the bacteria and is safe to drink.

After shock chlorinating the wells, test results show five water samples drawn from the subdivision's water supply on Oct. 18 are absent of bacteria, indicating the water is safe to drink.

<h3 class="postTitle" id="a2086185">
      
      
      
      
      
      
        Y@ Speak: The boil-your-water bye week
      

      
    </h3>
<h4 class="postedBy">
<span class="byAttribute">Posted</span>
<span class="byAttribute">By</span> <a href="https://www.bestofneworleans.com/gambit/ArticleArchives?author=1272785" rel="author">Lauren LaBorde</a>
<span class="twitter"><a href="http://www.twitter.com/laurenlaborde" target="_blank">@laurenlaborde</a></span>
        
        
          
            on <span class="postTime">Mon, Oct 15, 2012</span> at <span class="postTime">12:02 PM</span>
</h4>
<div class="postBody">
<p></p><blockquote class="twitter-tweet tw-align-center">PLEASE let boiled H2O cool before drinking. If water tastes flat, pour in a clean bottle and shake. If it still tastes flat, add to bourbon.<br/>— Mark Moseley (@moseleylensnola) <a data-datetime="2012-10-09T19:30:04+00:00" href="https://twitter.com/moseleylensnola/status/255752007296630785">October 9, 2012</a></blockquote><br/><script charset="utf-8" src="//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js"></script>New Orleans residents say we live in the Third World while using Twitter to complain about <a href="/blogofneworleans/archives/2012/10/08/boil-water-advisory-for-east-bank-of-orleans-parish">the boil water advisory issued last week</a> (hey, the Saints didn't play this week, so I guess everyone needed something to yell about). Also this week: it's Biden versus Ryan in the veep debate, changes in the <a href="/blogofneworleans/archives/2012/10/12/voodoo-experience-adds-metallica-to-lineup">Voodoo Experience lineup</a>, and a dude <a href="http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5jqO5eLDbuwm6EF37EDKEwnesVW3A?docId=f87ff3226c7d4992a2d93fa7330880b6">skydives from space</a>.
          
            <a name="more"></a>
<p><script src="http://storify.com/the_gambit/y-speak-10-23-10-29.js?header=false&border=false"></script></p><noscript>[<a href="http://storify.com/the_gambit/y-speak-10-23-10-29" target="_blank">View the story "Y@ Speak 10/23-10/29" on Storify</a>]<h1>Y@ Speak 10/23-10/29</h1><h2></h2>Storified by Gambit · Mon, Oct 15 2012 09:46:29<br/><div>ATTENTION NEW ORLEANIANS: Don't forget to save some bad water in jar so you can use it for mischief later.(A Ghost Named) Matt</div><div>y'all I screamed so loud when the saints won the power went out and now the water is dirty and everybody has to boil their water that's my bCyrus Cooper</div><div>Halfway shocked that the city hasn't issued an onslaught of "Boil Dat!" notifications.Geoff G</div><div>I'd be more inconvenienced by a "Boil White Wine Warning."colleen allerton</div><div>Fuck ima boil a shower?Champagne Cecil </div><div>Green Day announced they are unable to perform at Voodoo. We wish Billie Joe & the entire Green Day family our best. http://pic.twitter.com/WWnQuXxkVoodoo Experience</div><div>Boil-water advisory lifted! Go take a shower, NOLA.WWNO 89.9 FM</div><div>PLEASE let boiled H2O cool before drinking. If water tastes flat, pour in a clean bottle and shake. If it still tastes flat, add to bourbon.Mark Moseley</div><div>Wokeup thinking 1-4 sounds MUCH better than 0-5...still have to grind grind grindJonathan Vilma</div><div>When Anthony Davis stretches, his limbs extend into other dimensions #long http://pic.twitter.com/UZaaOWDNStephen Coston</div><div>Thank you NOLA. You delivered so hard. So happy! Thank you!!!DAN DEACON</div><div>To paraphrase from the Princess Bride, "New Orleans, you keep using the term 3rd World, I am not sure you know what that means."BlackenedOut</div><div>peper http://pic.twitter.com/cUXO9EVPl e i g h o s t</div><div>@skooks And they say NOLA's food truck laws are archaic and oppressive. Where are the Sunday drive-through daiquiris in Portland?Pontchartrain Pete</div><div>State of Print Media panel, VP debate, Stooges Brass Band or soul DJ night at BJ's? If only I could combine all into one. *dream sequence*Alison Fensterstock</div><div>Any gaffe u make in a debate follows you forever. Style & substance matters. Look into the camera, do not roll your eyes or expose your abs.Donna Brazile</div><div>Joe Biden is committing child abuse.  This is the only time I will every say that publicly beating a pimply teenager is AWESOME!JP Morrell</div><div>FYI: If the sign outside says “Speakeasy Bar,” then you’re not remotely a speakeasy bar.Todd A. Price</div><div>For the record, it's 3:00 pm and not a single table has left. Since 11:30 AM @galatoires#nolaLisa P. Smith</div><div>Surprise!  We'll be playing @VoodooNola in two weeks!  See you in New Orleans on October 27! #MetOnTour  http://bit.ly/RniY0oMetallica</div><div>Dear http://Nola.com,As an avid reader, friend of writers, occasional writer, and homesick expat...your phone app sucks.Brooks Hamaker</div><div>Man this clown might drop his phone or some change out his pockets..... Fuckin all our windshields and paint jobs from spaaaaaaaccccceeeeeSpitta</div><div>I got a screen grab of the Felix Baumgartner jump from space. http://pic.twitter.com/0NEF3bDkTaylor</div><div>I'm at the NOLA airport feeling bad for all these people who have to go home to their boring lives and don't get to live here.Sophie L Johnson</div></noscript>

<script type="text/javascript">
        var componentId = "Comments";

        function updateCommentTotals (showing,total){
          if (showing) {
            jQuery(".commentsShowingUpdate").each(function(){jQuery(this).html(showing)});
          }
          if (total==0) total="0";
          if (total){
            jQuery(".commentsTotalUpdate").each(function(){jQuery(this).html(total)});
          }
        }

        

        
        function getMoreComments (e) {
          if (e) e.preventDefault();
          if (jQuery(this).attr("id") == "showAllComments" || jQuery(this).attr("id") == "showMoreComments"){
            jQuery(this).parent().html('<div class="commentSpinner"> </div>');
          } else if (jQuery(this).attr("id") == "sortSelect"){
            jQuery("#Comments .sortSpinner").show();
          }

          var url = "/blogofneworleans/archives/2012/10/15/y-speak-the-boil-your-water-bye-week";
          var myStart = jQuery(this).attr("id") == "sortSelect" ? "1" : jQuery(this).attr("rel");
          var showAllComments = jQuery(this).attr("id") == "showAllComments" ? "yes" : "no";
          if (!myStart) var myStart = "1";
          var mySort = jQuery("#sortSelect").val() || "asc";
          var params = {
            sort: mySort,
            ajaxComponent: componentId,
            startIndex: myStart,
            showAll: showAllComments
          };
          jQuery.ajax({
              url: url,
              data: (params),
              success: function (data) {
                  jQuery("#"+componentId+"_PaginationBottom").remove();
                  jQuery("#"+componentId+"_commentContent .brandNewComment").remove();
                  jQuery("#Comments .sortSpinner").hide();
                  if (myStart == "1") jQuery("#"+componentId+"_commentContent").html(data);
                  else jQuery("#"+componentId+"_commentContent").append(data);
              }
          });
        };

        function removeEdit(oid){
          if (oid){
            var cont = jQuery("#Comments-comment-"+oid).closest(".brandNewComment");
            cont.find(".newCommentOptions").fadeOut("fast", function(){
              jQuery(this).remove();
            });
          }
        }

        function getComment(oid, commentLimit){
          var url = "/blogofneworleans/archives/2012/10/15/y-speak-the-boil-your-water-bye-week";
          var limitMsg = commentLimit?"<div class=\"comment limitMsg\">\r\n\r\n      \r\n      \r\n        Note: Since you've already made  live comments to day(s)ay, this and any additional comments in this timeframe will be reviewed by our staff before being made live.  Thank you for your contribution!\r\n          \r\n    <\/div>":'';
          if (oid){
            var params = {
              ajaxComponent: componentId,
              commentOid: oid
            };
            jQuery.ajax({
                url: url,
                data: (params),
                success: function (data) {
                  if (!jQuery.trim(jQuery("#"+componentId+"_commentContent").html())){
                    jQuery("#"+componentId+"_commentContent").append(limitMsg+data).find(".brandNewComment").fadeIn("fast");
                  } else {
                    jQuery("#"+componentId+"_commentContent").children("div.comment, div.brandNewComment, div.limitMsg").filter(":last").after(limitMsg+data).parent().find(".brandNewComment").fadeIn("fast");
                  }
                  var t=setTimeout(function(){removeEdit(oid)},300000);
                  var myTotal = parseInt(jQuery("#comments_total").text(), 10);
                  myTotal++;
                  updateCommentTotals(false,myTotal);
                }
            });
          }
        }

        function doLikeComment(e){
          e.preventDefault();
          if (!this.clicked){
            var oid = jQuery(this).attr("data-commentOid");
            jQuery("#Comments #"+oid+"_likeLinks a").addClass("dimmed").css("opacity","0.4").each(function(){this.clicked = true;});

            var myCurrentLikes = jQuery("#"+oid+"_rating_likes").html() || 0;
            var myCurrentDislikes = jQuery("#"+oid+"_rating_dislikes").html() || 0;

            var thisRating = jQuery(this).attr("rel");
            if (thisRating == "Like"){
              myCurrentLikes = parseFloat(myCurrentLikes)+1;
            } else {
              myCurrentDislikes = parseFloat(myCurrentDislikes)+1;
            }
            var myNewLine = '<span id="'+oid+'_rating_likes">' + myCurrentLikes + '</span> like';
            if (myCurrentLikes != 1) {
              myNewLine += 's';
            }
            myNewLine += ', ' + '<span id="'+oid+'_rating_dislikes">' + myCurrentDislikes + '</span> dislike';
            if (myCurrentDislikes != 1) {
              myNewLine += "s";
            }

            jQuery("#"+oid+"_rating_sub").html(myNewLine);
            jQuery("#"+oid+"_rating_sub").show();

            var params = {
              oid: oid,
              rating: thisRating
            };
            jQuery.ajax({
                url: "/gyrobase/Tools/AjaxLike",
                type: "POST",
                data: (params),
                success: function (data) {
                  jQuery("#"+oid+"_rating_sub").html(data);
                  if (thisRating == "Like"){
                    jQuery("#Comments #"+oid+"_likeLinks a.dislike").removeClass("dimmed").css("opacity","1").each(function(){this.clicked = false;});
                  } else {
                    jQuery("#Comments #"+oid+"_likeLinks a.like").removeClass("dimmed").css("opacity","1").each(function(){this.clicked = false;});
                  }
                }
            });
          }
        }

        function reportComment(e){
          e.preventDefault();
          e.stopPropagation();
          var oid = jQuery(this).attr("rel");
          var elem = jQuery("#"+oid+"_report");
          elem.click(function(e){e.stopPropagation();})
          if (!elem.is(":visible")){
            jQuery("#Comments .reportCommentContainer").hide();
            if (elem.is(":empty")){
              var params = {
                oid: oid,
                ajaxComponent: "ReportComment"
              };
              jQuery.ajax({
                  url: "/gyrobase/Tools/ReportComment",
                  data: (params),
                  success: function (data) {
                    elem.html(data);
                    elem.fadeIn("fast");
                  }
              });
            } else {
              elem.fadeIn("fast");
            }
          }
          // attach close event handler to the html
          jQuery("html").one("click", function(){
            jQuery("#Comments .reportCommentContainer:visible").hide();
          });
        }

        function closeReport(obj){
          jQuery(obj).closest(".reportCommentContainer").fadeOut("fast");
        }

        function submitReport(e){
          var params = jQuery(e).closest("form").serialize()+"&ajaxComponent=ReportComment";
          jQuery.ajax({
              url: "/gyrobase/Tools/ReportComment",
              type: "POST",
              data: (params),
              success: function (data) {
                jQuery(e).closest(".reportCommentContainer").html(data);
              }
          });
        }

        (function($) {
          var subscribed=false;

          function showFollowPanel(e){
            e.preventDefault();
            myPanel = $(this).parent().next(".togglePanel");
            myPanel.fadeIn("fast");
          }

          function doSubscribe(obj){
            var myPanel = obj.parent().next(".togglePanel");
            myPanel.fadeIn("fast");
            if (!subscribed){
              var myLink = obj.parent();
              var myLoader = myPanel.children(".loading");
              var myUpdater = myPanel.children(".ajaxUpdater");
              var params = {
                object: myPanel.attr("data-toolsoid"),
                macro: myPanel.attr("data-toolsajaxmacro"),
                url: window.location
              };

              $.ajax({
                url: "/gyrobase/Macros/ToolsAjax",
                data: (params),
                type: "POST",
                dataType: "html",
                success: function (data) {
                  subscribed = true;
                  if (myUpdater){
                    myUpdater.html(data);
                    myLoader.fadeOut("fast", function(){
                      myUpdater.fadeIn("fast", function(){
                        setTimeout(function(){
                          myPanel.fadeOut("fast");
                        }, 3000);
                      });
                    });
                  } else {
                    myPanel.fadeOut("fast");
                  }
                }
              });
            }
          }

          function activateSubscribe(e){
            e.preventDefault();
            var myObj = $(this);
            var isAuthenticated = Foundation.SessionManager.sharedSessionManager().isAuthenticated();
            if (!isAuthenticated){
              new Foundation.Login.Dialog({
                  "feelingShy": false,
                  "callback": function(){doSubscribe(myObj);}
              });
              return false;
            } else {
              // Proceed
              doSubscribe(myObj);
            }
          }

          function deleteComment(e){
            e.preventDefault();
            var thisComment = $(this);
            var params = {
              macro: "deleteComment",
              comment: thisComment.attr("data-comment")
            };
            $.ajax({
              url: "/gyrobase/Macros/ToolsAjax",
              data: (params),
              type: "POST",
              dataType: "html",
              success: function (data) {
                thisComment.closest(".brandNewComment").fadeOut("fast", function(){
                  $(this).remove();
                  var myTotal = parseInt(jQuery("#comments_total").text(), 10);
                  myTotal--;
                  updateCommentTotals(false,myTotal);
                });
              }
            });
          }

          function editComment(e){
            e.preventDefault();
            var thisComment = $(this);
            var commentCont = thisComment.closest(".brandNewComment").find(".description");
            var commentTemp = thisComment.closest(".brandNewComment").find(".commentTemp");
            var commentText = commentTemp.html();
            var toolbar = thisComment.closest(".brandNewComment").find(".commentToolbar");
            commentCont.next(".commentEditCont").remove();
            commentCont.after('<div class="commentEditCont clearfix" style="display:none;"><div class="editErrorDisplay" style="display:none"><ol></ol></div><textarea class="expandableBox">'+commentText+'</textarea><a href="#" class="cancelEditLink">Cancel</a> <a href="#" class="doneEditLink" data-comment="'+thisComment.attr("data-comment")+'">SAVE</a></div>');
            toolbar.fadeOut("fast");
            commentCont.fadeOut("fast", function(){
              commentCont.next(".commentEditCont").fadeIn("fast", function(){
                $(".brandNewComment textarea.expandableBox").autoBoxResize();
                $(".brandNewComment textarea.expandableBox").focus();
              });
            });
          }

          function editCommentSave(e){
            e.preventDefault();
            var thisComment = $(this);
            var editCont = thisComment.closest(".commentEditCont");
            var commentTemp = thisComment.closest(".brandNewComment").find(".commentTemp");
            var newText = thisComment.prevAll("textarea").val();
            var toolbar = thisComment.closest(".brandNewComment").find(".commentToolbar");

            var params = {
              macro: "editComment",
              comment: thisComment.attr("data-comment"),
              commentText: newText
            };
            $.ajax({
              url: "/gyrobase/Macros/ToolsAjax",
              data: (params),
              type: "POST",
              success: function (data) {
                if (data.error){
                  $(".editErrorDisplay").html("<ol><li>"+data.error+"</li></ol>").fadeIn("fast");
                } else if (data.result){
                  editCont.fadeOut("fast", function(){
                    $(".editErrorDisplay").hide().html("<ol></ol>");
                    editCont.prev(".description").html($.trim(data.result));
                    commentTemp.html(newText);
                    editCont.prev(".description").fadeIn("fast");
                    toolbar.fadeIn("fast");
                  });
                }
              }
            });
          }

          function editCommentCancel(e){
            e.preventDefault();
            var editCont = $(this).closest(".commentEditCont");
            var toolbar = $(this).closest(".brandNewComment").find(".commentToolbar");
            editCont.fadeOut("fast", function(){
              $(".editErrorDisplay").hide().html("<ol></ol>");
              editCont.prev(".description").fadeIn("fast");
              toolbar.fadeIn("fast");
              editCont.remove();
            });
          }

          $("#Comments").on('click', ".bottomOptionBar a#doSubscribe", activateSubscribe);
          $("#Comments").on('click', ".bottomOptionBar a.togglePanelClose", function(){$(this).parent().fadeOut("fast"); return false;});
          $("#Comments").on('click', ".brandNewComment a.commentDeleteLink", deleteComment);
          $("#Comments").on('click', ".brandNewComment a.commentEditLink", editComment);
          $("#Comments").on('click', ".brandNewComment a.doneEditLink", editCommentSave);
          $("#Comments").on('click', ".brandNewComment a.cancelEditLink", editCommentCancel);
        })(jQuery);


        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
          $("#Comments").on('click', '#showMoreComments,#showAllComments', getMoreComments);
          $("#Comments #sortSelect").change(getMoreComments);
          getMoreComments();
          new Foundation.PostCommentComponent(componentId);
          var nc = Foundation.NotificationCenter.sharedNotificationCenter();
          nc.observe("comment:added", function (e) {
            var comment = e.data;
              getComment(comment.get("oid"), comment.get("commentLimit"));
            // clear rating
            if (jQuery(".commentFormRating").length!=0){
              jQuery(".commentFormRating input[name='reviewRating']").val("");
              jQuery(".commentFormRating .goldStarContainer").css("left", zeroPos+"px");
            }
          });
          var subscribeCheckBox = $("#Comments_commentSubscribe");
          subscribeCheckBox.prop("checked", getCookie("subscribeToThread") === "true" ? true : false);
          subscribeCheckBox.change(function (e) {
              var subscribeToThread = $(this).prop("checked");
              setCookie("subscribeToThread", subscribeToThread ? "true" : "false", 30);
          });
          var shareFacebookBox = $("#Comments_postCommentToFacebook");
          shareFacebookBox.prop("checked", getCookie("shareOnFacebook") === "true" ? true : false);
          shareFacebookBox.change(function (e) {
              var shareOnFacebook = $(this).prop("checked");
              setCookie("shareOnFacebook", shareOnFacebook ? "true" : "false", 30);
          });
          $("#Comments").on('click', 'a.likeLink', doLikeComment);
          $("#Comments").on('click', 'a.reportCommentLink', reportComment);
        });
      </script>
<!-- end gridMainColumn -->
</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
<!--
  function showPopupCalendar (e) {
      var calid = this.id + ":dncal";
      var cal = $(calid).up();
      if (!cal) return;

      if (cal.visible()) {
          cal.blindUp({ duration: 0.3 });
      }
      else {
          dnCalendar.registry[calid].redraw();
          cal.blindDown({ duration: 0.3 });
      } 
  };

  function popupCalendarCallback (date, id) {
      var month = date.getMonth() >= 9 ? date.getMonth() + 1 : "0" + (date.getMonth() + 1);
      var day = date.getDate() >= 10 ? date.getDate() : "0" + date.getDate();
      var d = date.getFullYear() + "-" + month + "-" + day;
      
        window.location = "https://www.bestofneworleans.com/gambit/EventSearch&narrowByDate=" + d;
      
  };

  /* Via quirksmode.org--more consistent positioning. */
  function findPos(obj) {
    var curleft = curtop = 0;
    if (obj.offsetParent) {
      curleft = obj.offsetLeft;
      curtop = obj.offsetTop;
      while (obj = obj.offsetParent) {
        curleft += obj.offsetLeft;
        curtop += obj.offsetTop;
      }
    }
    return [curleft, curtop];
  }

  // Add popup calendar to the page.
  dnAddEvent(window, "dndomload", function () {
      var link = $("ListingsSearchPopupCalendar"); if (!link) return;
      dnAddEvent(link, "click", window.showPopupCalendar);
      if (!link.id) link.id = "__dnPopupCalendarLink" + i;
      var id = link.id;
      var cal = new dnCalendar(id+":dncal", window.popupCalendarCallback, null, "none");
      var offset = findPos($(id));
      $(cal.id).wrap("div").hide().setStyle({
          position: "absolute",
          left: (offset[0] - 117) + "px",
          top: (offset[1] + 20) + "px"
      });
      $(cal.id).show().setStyle({ position: "static", padding: "2px" });
  });

  // XXX - needs site specific CSS
  dnCalendarDefaultStyle();
//-->
</script>

Beaufort County No Longer Under Boil Water Advisory

Posted: Mon 10:25 AM, Oct 15, 2012 &nbsp|&nbsp
Updated: Tue 10:07 AM, Oct 16, 2012

Beaufort County says water pressure has been restored and tests show no coliform bacteria contamination to the water supply in the northwest portion of the county.

Customers in the Washington Township service area had been told to conserve water and boil it for human consumption after an equipment failure on Monday.

Previous Story

Equipment failure is causing some Beaufort County residents to boil their water.

All Beaufort County water customers in the Washington Township service area are experiencing low or no water pressure. They are being told to boil all water for one minute that is used for human consumption.

The impact area includes U.S. 264 west of Page Rd. extending to the Pitt County line, customers on Cherry Run Rd., U.S. Highway 17 North, NC Highway 171 North, and Market Street Extension extending to the Martin County Line.

Residents are also being asked to conserve water whenever possible.

        var getPreBidVarValue = function() {
            var constructedVar;
            var urlPathReg = /([^\/]*)\/*$/;
            var classifiedSearchReg = /homes|cars|jobs|search/;
            var urlPath = window.location.pathname;
            var lastUrlComponent = urlPath.match(urlPathReg)[1];
            var marketIdentifier = mi.pageInfo.getConf('marketInfo.market_identifier');
            var pageLevel = mi.pageInfo.getConf('marketInfo.pagelevel');
            var sourceLevel = mi.pageInfo.getConf('marketInfo.sourcelevel');
            var isArticle = new RegExp(/.html$/).test(urlPath);
            if ( lastUrlComponent === 'video' ) {
                pageLevel = 'videofront';
            } else if ( lastUrlComponent === 'galleries' ) {
                pageLevel = 'galleryfront';
            } else if ( lastUrlComponent.match(classifiedSearchReg) ) {
                pageLevel = pageLevel + '.' + sourceLevel;
            } else if (urlPath.search("/weather/") !== -1  && !isArticle) {
                pageLevel = 'sectfront.weather';
            } else if (urlPath.search("/latest-news/") !== -1 && !isArticle) {
                pageLevel = 'sectfront.latestnews';
            } else if (urlPath.search("-columns-blogs/") !== -1 && !isArticle) {
                pageLevel = 'blogfront';
            }

            if ( mi_Ads.env.outOfMarket.pageLevelOOM === true && mi_Ads.env.outOfMarket.serverOOMHeader === true ) {
                pageLevel = pageLevel + '-oom';
            }

            constructedVar = marketIdentifier + '.' + pageLevel;

            return constructedVar;
        };
        var preBidMarketPage = getPreBidVarValue();
    </script>

                        October 15, 2012 08:08 AM

<div class="dateline-storybody">
<div class="clearfix" id="story-target">
<div class="content-body" id="content-body-">
<p>Manatee County Utilities Department has issued a precautionary boil water notice for customers in the Palma Sola Square Shopping Plaza, which will affect a Starbucks coffee shop, Salem’s Gyros & Subs, Basil's Chicken & Ribs and Ezra Cafe.</p>
<p>A fire hydrant installation is scheduled for Wednesday morning. The water will be shut off from 12:30 a.m. until 3:30 a.m.</p>
<p>Once service is restored, all water used for drinking or cooking should be boiled as a precaution. A rolling boil of one minute is sufficient. As an alternative, bottled water may be used.</p>
<p>This precautionary notice will remain in effect until a bacteriological survey has shown the water to be safe, normally 24-48 hours. A rescission notice will be issued when lifted. To ask questions, call 941-792-8811, ext. 5268 between 7 a.m. and 5 p.m. or (941) 747-HELP after 5 p.m. or on weekends.</p>

            var eventMethod = window.addEventListener ? "addEventListener" : "attachEvent";
            var eventer = window[eventMethod];
            var messageEvent = eventMethod == "attachEvent" ? "onmessage" : "message";
            
            $("<iframe/>", {
                "class" : "col-xs-12",
                "src" : randomUrl,
                "scrolling" : "no",
                "frameborder" : "no"
            }).appendTo("#newsletter-signUpWidget");
            
            eventer(messageEvent, function(e) {
                if (randomUrl.indexOf(e.origin) != -1 ) {
                    var key = e.message ? "message" : "data";
                    var data = JSON.parse(e[key]);
                    
                    switch(data.messageid) {
                        case 100:
                            var signupevent = new CustomEvent( 'signup', {"detail": data} );
                            window.dispatchEvent( signupevent );
                            break;
                        case 200:
                            $('#newsletter-signUpWidget iframe').css('height', data.iframe.height);
                            break;
                    }

                }
            }, false );
        })();
    </script>
