<!--Needs to be on the DOM on page load for IE. Needs to be visible to set the correct height of the comment component. I'm hiding it on document ready. Appending it later did not work-->
<div class="fb-comments in" data-href="" data-numposts="10" data-width="100%" id="fb-comments"></div>
<script>
(function(){
  var $commentingContainer = $('#commenting-container'),
      $commentContainerChevron = $commentingContainer.find(".glyphicon-chevron-down"),
      $fbComments = $("#fb-comments");
      
    if($("meta[property='fb:app_id']").length === 1 && $("meta[name='allow-comments']").prop("content") === "true") {
         
      $commentingContainer.on('click', 'a.comments-toggle', function(){
        if (typeof mi.commenting === "undefined") {
            mi.commenting = new mi.Commenting();
            mi.commenting.setConf( {
                accountName: mi.pageInfo.getConf('marketInfo.domain'),
                fbapp_id: mi.pageInfo.getConf('facebook.app.id'),
                fb_comment_div: {'data-width': '100%'}
            });
            mi.commenting.display();
            FB.XFBML.parse(document.getElementById("fb-comments"));
        }
        
        toggleComments();
      });
      
      $(document).ready(function(){
        toggleComments();
      });
      
    } else {
      
        var disabledText = 'Comments have been disabled for this story.';
        $fbComments.prepend("<p><strong>" + disabledText + "</strong></p>");
        
    }
    
    //toggleClass() wasn't working in IE the first time if it has the class
    function toggleComments(){
      if ($fbComments.hasClass('in')) {
          $fbComments.removeClass('in');
          $commentContainerChevron.removeClass("rotate");
      }else {
          $fbComments.addClass('in');
          $commentContainerChevron.addClass("rotate");
      }
    }
})();
</script>

Water service restored to Cairo residents

Carly O'Keefe, Anchor
BioEmail
Connect
Biography
cokeefe@kfvs12.com
Illinois American Water is the supplier for Cairo's water system (Source: Arnold Wyrick).
Water tankers from Peoria are on their way to the fire department (Source: Arnold Wyrick).
Residents were able to get donated water on Sunday (Source: Arnold Wyrick).
CAIRO, IL (KFVS) -

Illinois American Water has restored water service to customers in its Cairo District. But, a boil water order is in effect for customers in the Cairo service area due to a temporary interruption in water service.

Many reported little to no water pressure Sunday morning in Cairo due to water system problems and low Ohio River levels. Because of those water problems, there is no school on Monday.

According to Cairo School District 1, school was closed on Monday, October 15 due to the water shortage and boil water order in place.

School will be back in session on Tuesday, according to Superintendent Andrea Evers. The school will have bottled water available for all students and that water fountains are covered.

Cairo Mayor Tyrone Coleman says something went wrong with Illinois American Water's system intake valve on the Ohio River around 9:30 Saturday night.  

"I would just like to ask everyone not to panic. Everything is going to be okay," said Mayor Coleman. "We just don't know how long we're going to be without water. But we're tapping into other resources."

Still residents are frustrated.

"It's disturbing because a lot of kids, a lot of people have children," said Barbara Sales of Cairo. "I have grandchildren. Then there are people with babies that have to use the water to make formula, and it's just disturbing."

Coleman says the city has lost water pressure to the point much of the city was without water on Sunday. 

The mayor says divers have been in the river since early Sunday trying to find the problem. He says those in need of water should contact city hall. Any available water will be able to be picked up at the Cairo Fire Department.

Illinois American Water distributed bottled water at the Cairo Fire Department.

Cairo citizens needing water are encouraged to access this free water service, located at 1513 Washington Street in Cairo.

The city also called area retailers to donate water. 

Illinois American Water asked its customers to limit water consumption to critical uses only like bathing, cooking and healthcare need during the shortage.

According to American Water, water to be used for drinking or cooking will need to be boiled prior to consumption.  A rolling boil for five minutes is recommended.

Water officials say water is OK for bathing, washing and other common uses. The boil water advisory will be in effect until water quality samples confirm that the water is safe for consumption.

It is standard procedure as required by Illinois Environmental Protection Agency for a boil water order to be in effect for 36 to 48 hours after water service is restored.

Customers will be notified when the boil water order is lifted. Customers may call Illinois American Water's 24-hour Customer Service Center at 1-800-422-2782 for more information.

This boil water advisory is being issued in accordance with Illinois Environmental Protection Agency regulations. 

Illinois American Water say they are working diligently to restore water service to Cairo.

Illinois American Water Cairo District customers will receive notification of the situation through Illinois American Water's customer notification system which utilizes customer contact information to relay critical water service  messages.

Illinois American Water is also working with city staff, emergency officials and local media to relay this information.

Precautionary boil water alert issued for Kissimmee subdivisions
Last Updated: Sunday, October 14, 2012
KISSIMMEE -- 

The Toho Water Authority has issued a precautionary boil water alert.

The alert was issued because of equipment failure at the Pleasant Hills Lake water treatment plant early Sunday morning. The failure caused a loss of pressure in areas of the system.

Approximately 1,000 homes in the Pleasant Hill Lakes, Eagle Lake and Parkview at Lakeshore subdivisions are affected.

Residents should boil their water for one minute for drinking, cooking, making ice, brushing teeth or washing dishes.

If you have any questions, contact the Toho Water Authority at (407) 944-5000.

	};
    // PAGE DATA
	var isDwp = false;

	var isHome = isDwp && false;
	console.log("page Title:" + 'WSU issues boil advisory on campus');
	var trimPageNameUrl = removeExtracharFromUrl('/news/local/wsu-issues-boil-advisory-campus/yIxkFCFoSv9bUtHoGrybcO/');
	
	DDO.pageData = {
		pageFlow : "",
		pageNumber : '1',
		pageType : 'infinite scroll',
		pageIsDwp: isDwp // Necessary for bookmarklet purposes.
	};
	if(isDwp) {
	    DDO.pageData.pageContentType = (isHome) ? 'homepage' : 'section front';
		DDO.pageData.pageMainSection = (isHome) ? '/'+'homepage' : '/news/local/wsu-issues-boil-advisory-campus/yIxkFCFoSv9bUtHoGrybcO/';
		DDO.pageData.pageName = (isHome) ? '/' + 'homepage' + '/' : '/news/local/wsu-issues-boil-advisory-campus/yIxkFCFoSv9bUtHoGrybcO/';
	} else {
	    DDO.pageData.pageContentType = 'article';
		DDO.pageData.pageMainSection ='/news/local';
		DDO.pageData.pageName = trimPageNameUrl;
	}
	
	DDO.pageData.pageTitle = 'WSU issues boil advisory on campus';
	DDO.pageData.pageSiteSection = (isHome) ? 'home' : 'News';
	 
	if (DDO.pageData.pageContentType == '') {
		var pageName = DDO.pageData.pageName;
		var pageNameSplit = pageName.split('/');
		DDO.pageData.pageContentType = pageNameSplit[1];
	} 
	
	DDO.pageData.pageCategory = 'Local';
	if (DDO.pageData.pageCategory == 'Error') {
		DDO.pageData.pageContentType = "Page not found";
	}
	DDO.pageData.pageSubCategory = '';
	
	// CONTENT DATA (contentViewType is set in access meter metrics)
	DDO.contentData = DDO.contentData || {};
	var contentTopics ='';
	
	DDO.contentData.contentTopics = contentTopics;
	var contentByline = '';
	
	DDO.contentData.contentByline = contentByline + " " + 'www.whiotv.com';
	
	DDO.contentData.contentOriginatingSite =  'cmgoldcontent';
	DDO.contentData.contentID = 'db128461-eb8b-485f-8ecc-b48b15abba16';
	DDO.contentData.contentVendor = '';
	DDO.contentData.contentViewType = DDO.contentData.contentViewType || '';
	DDO.contentData.contentPublishDate = '20121014150603';
	DDO.contentData.blogName = '';
	DDO.contentData.galleryName = '';
	var pageSubContentType = '';
	if(pageSubContentType == 'Post') {
		DDO.contentData.blogName = 'WSU issues boil advisory on campus';
	}else if(DDO.pageData.pageContentType == 'gallery') {
		DDO.contentData.galleryName = 'WSU issues boil advisory on campus';
	}
	
	//We need to set this one only for imported stories.
	DDO.contentData.contentOriginatingCMS='Medley';
	DDO.contentData.contentOriginatingID='1501261';
	DDO.contentData.melvilID='news.medleystory.1501261';
	
	//SEARCH DATA PAGE CONTENT
	
		
   
  
   DDO.pageData.pageNumber = location.search.split('page=')[1] ? location.search.split('page=')[1] : location.search.split('offset=')[1] ? location.search.split('offset=')[1] : '1';
   
<!-- begin metrics_elements_override block -->


<!-- end metrics_elements_override block -->	
	
	// The following code defers loading the DTM library until after certain events have been fired,
	// namely janrain, mg2, and access meter.
	// Note: we need to add access meter to list of dependent events etc!
	DDO.dependentEvents = dependentEvents;// e.g. ['authn', 'authz'];
	  setTimeout(function(){
		DDO.dependentEventCheck("TIMED OUT");
	}, 10000); 
	if(dependentEvents.length == 0){
		DDO.utilities.triggerDTMPageView();//DDO.utilities.loadDTMLibrary();
	}
	
	pubsub.publish("DDO-initialized");

}

//Function to remove last alphanumeric chars from DDO.pageData.pageName url
function removeExtracharFromUrl(urlPath){
    var urlArr = urlPath.split('/');
    if (urlArr.length > 3) {
    	var urlArr_new = [];
		for (var i=0; i<urlArr.length-2;i++) {
			urlArr_new.push(urlArr[i]);
		}
		return urlArr_new.join('/') + '/';
    } 
    else {
    	return urlPath;	
    }
}

<script>
DDO.authn = {
	init: function(pubsub, $){
		var hasLocalStorage = DDO.hasLocalStorage();
		DDO.userData = DDO.userData || {};
		if(hasLocalStorage){
			DDO.userData.userStatus = localStorage.getItem("metricsUserStatus")||"";
			DDO.userData.userActive = localStorage.getItem("metricsUserActive")||"";
			DDO.userData.userType = localStorage.getItem("metricsUserType")||"";
			if(localStorage.getItem("janrainCaptureReturnExperienceData")){
				DDO.userData.userProfileID = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem("janrainCaptureReturnExperienceData"))["uuid"] ||"";
			}
		}
		pubsub.subscribe("authn-login", function(event, data){
			DDO.userData.userStatus = 'registered';
			DDO.userData.userActive = 'logged-in';
			DDO.userData.userType = 'standard';
			if(hasLocalStorage){
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserStatus", DDO.userData.userStatus);
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserActive", DDO.userData.userActive);
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserType", DDO.userData.userType);
			}
			DDO.userData.userProfileID = data.uuid;
			DDO.dependentEventCheck('authn');
		});
		pubsub.subscribe("authn-anonymous", function(event, data){
			DDO.userData.userStatus = 'not registered';
			DDO.userData.userActive = 'not logged-in';
			DDO.userData.userType = 'anonymous';
			delete DDO.userData.userProfileID;
			if(hasLocalStorage){
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserStatus", DDO.userData.userStatus);
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserActive", DDO.userData.userActive);
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserType", DDO.userData.userType);
			}
			DDO.dependentEventCheck('authn');
			DDO.dependentEventCheck('authz');
		});
		pubsub.subscribe("authn-modal-open", function(event, data){
			if(typeof(window.janrainClickTracker)!="undefined"){
				if(typeof(DDO.loginEventClickNumber)!="undefined"){
					if(window.janrainClickTracker == DDO.loginEventClickNumber){
						return;
					}
				}
				DDO.loginEventClickNumber = window.janrainClickTracker;
			}
			DDO.action('loginEvent_start');
		});
 		pubsub.subscribe("login-complete", function(event, data){
			DDO.action('loginEvent_complete');
		});
		pubsub.subscribe("authn-logout", function(event, data){
			DDO.userData.userStatus = 'not registered';
			DDO.userData.userActive = 'not logged-in';
			DDO.userData.userType = 'anonymous';
			delete DDO.userData.userProfileID;
			if(hasLocalStorage){
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserStatus", DDO.userData.userStatus);
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserActive", DDO.userData.userActive);
				localStorage.setItem("metricsUserType", DDO.userData.userType);
			}
			DDO.action('loginEvent_logout');
		});		
		// When user is auto-logged in.
		pubsub.subscribe("authn-login-return", function(event, data) {
			 DDO.action('loginEvent_return-user');
			 DDO.dependentEventCheck("authz");
		});
		pubsub.subscribe("registration-success", function(event, data) {
			DDO.action('loginEvent_new-user-register');
			
		});
		pubsub.subscribe("login-error", function(event, data) {
			DDO.action('loginEvent_error');
		});
	}
};
</script>

<script>
DDO.interaction = {
	init: function(pubsub, $){
		// pubsubcutioner can use regex for event names, thus all interaction type events
		// can be listened to assuming the data is correct.
		pubsub.subscribe("site-interaction", function(event, data){
			// data should be like: {element:"[widget clicked]",action: "[button clicked]"}
			DDO.action(event, data);
		});
	}
};
</script>

};

			$('#swiper_790928').show();
			$(parentDropdown).find('.dropdown-menu').fadeIn(0);
			var galleryTop = new Swiper("#swiper_790928 .swiper-container", {

				var swiperName = new Swiper('#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news .swiper-container', {
					loop : true,
					speed : 600,
					autoplay : 8000,
					direction : 'horizontal',
					slidesPerView : 1,
					paginationClickable: false,
					nextButton : '#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news .next',
					prevButton : '#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news .prev',
					onSlideChangeStart: function(event) {
						var currentSlide = parseInt($('#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news .swiper-slide-active').attr('data-swiper-slide-index'))
						$('#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news #current-slide').html(currentSlide + 1);
						
						$('#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news .prefix h2 span').fadeOut(changeSpeed).promise().done(function(){
							var thisPrefix = $('#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news .prefix h2').children().eq($('#swiper_628777.alerts.breaking-news .swiper-slide-active').attr('data-swiper-slide-index'));
							thisPrefix.fadeIn(changeSpeed)

					}
				});
				if(1 == 1){
					swiperName.lockSwipes();
				}
			});

<h1 class="headline">
            WSU issues boil advisory on campus
         </h1>
<p>
<strong>Published: </strong>Sunday, October 14, 2012 @ 11:06 AM<br/>
<strong>Updated: </strong>Sunday, October 14, 2012 @ 11:06 AM<br/>
<span class="bylines">
<strong>By: </strong>

					www.whiotv.com</span>
</p>
<div class="lead-image-container">
<!-- don't show anything -->
</div>
<div class="socialShareButtons">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="Wright State University has issued a campus wide water boil advisory Sunday morning.The university’s text alert system notified students and faculty that the entire campus must boil water before it is safe for consumption." data-janrain-title="WSU issues boil advisory on campus " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/wsu-issues-boil-advisory-campus/yIxkFCFoSv9bUtHoGrybcO/"></div>
</div>
<div class="article-container">
<!-- ARTICLE TEXT -->
<p><span class="article-dateline">
<span class="date-line-city">FAIRBORN, Ohio</span>
</span>
<span> — </span>Wright State University has issued a campus wide water boil advisory Sunday morning.</p><p>The university’s text alert system notified students and faculty that the entire campus must boil water before it is safe for consumption.</p><p>27 of WSU’s 28 residence halls receive their water supply from the City of Fairborn’s system and are unaffected by the advisory. The university is supplying clean drinking water to the residents of Hamilton Hall, the one hall affected by the advisory, a university spokesperson said.</p><p>The water is safe for all purposes other than consumption, a university spokesperson said.</p><p>A low water level in the campus’ water tower prompted the advisory, the university said in a phone message to students and faculty.</p><div class="clearfix ">The advisory is in place until further notice, the alert said.</div><div class="socialShareButtons" style="margin-top:10px;">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="Wright State University has issued a campus wide water boil advisory Sunday morning.The university’s text alert system notified students and faculty that the entire campus must boil water before it is safe for consumption." data-janrain-title="WSU issues boil advisory on campus " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/wsu-issues-boil-advisory-campus/yIxkFCFoSv9bUtHoGrybcO/"></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="object-well" data-canonicalurl="http://www.whio.com/news/local/husted-bucks-gop-against-voter-photo-push/1szTm6BWbcT6I9qQdKQ10M/" id="o-21517544914">
<h1 class="headline">
            Husted bucks GOP, is against voter photo ID push
         </h1>
<p>
<strong>Published: </strong>Friday, April 08, 2011 @ 6:11 AM<br/>
<strong>Updated: </strong>Friday, April 08, 2011 @ 6:11 AM<br/>
<span class="bylines">
<strong>By: </strong>

					































	
		
	
	
	
the Associated Press		
					-
					www.newstalkradiowhio.com</span>
</p>
<div class="lead-image-container">
<!-- don't show anything -->
</div>
<div class="socialShareButtons">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) -- The official who oversees Ohio's elections says he doesn't agree with a measure proposed by some fellow Republicans to require voters to show photo IDs at the polls." data-janrain-title="Husted bucks GOP, is against voter photo ID push " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/husted-bucks-gop-against-voter-photo-push/1szTm6BWbcT6I9qQdKQ10M/"></div>
</div>
<div class="article-container">
<!-- ARTICLE TEXT -->
<p>COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) -- The official who oversees Ohio's elections says he doesn't agree with a measure proposed by some fellow Republicans to require voters to show photo IDs at the polls.    <br/><br/>Secretary of State John Husted tells The Columbus Dispatch on Thursday that he would not change current policy that allows voters to prove their identities with photo IDs or other documents, such as utility bills or paychecks.    <br/><br/>A bill approved by the Ohio House would require voters to show the photo ID before casting an in-person ballot. It is now being reviewed by the Senate.    <br/><br/>Husted instead proposes changes for voters casting early ballots or provisional ballots. He says those voters should be required to give their full Social Security numbers instead of the currently required last four digits.</p><div class="socialShareButtons" style="margin-top:10px;">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) -- The official who oversees Ohio's elections says he doesn't agree with a measure proposed by some fellow Republicans to require voters to show photo IDs at the polls." data-janrain-title="Husted bucks GOP, is against voter photo ID push " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/husted-bucks-gop-against-voter-photo-push/1szTm6BWbcT6I9qQdKQ10M/"></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cm-ad RP03 story-1" id="cm-ad-31042"></div>

<h1 class="headline">
            New restaurants, retail shops coming to Oxford
         </h1>
<p>
<strong>Published: </strong>Friday, October 28, 2016 @ 2:25 PM<br/>

<span class="bylines">

<div class="lead-image-container">

</div>
<div class="socialShareButtons">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="New restaurants and retail shops are coming to a development on the former Walmart site in Oxford.Bishop Square — a 50,000-square-foot mixed use development at 419 Locust Street that currently includes 272 units of student housing — is adding Marco’s Pizza, Tim Hortons, a Sprint retail store and a bank." data-janrain-title="New restaurants, retail shops coming to Oxford " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/new-restaurants-retail-shops-coming-oxford/O2c2TxfjLOdrYELXvfOUtM/"></div>
</div>
<div class="article-container">
<!-- ARTICLE TEXT -->
<p><span class="article-dateline">
<span class="date-line-city">OXFORD</span>
</span>
<span> — </span>New restaurants and retail shops are coming to a development on the former Walmart site in Oxford.</p><p>Bishop Square — a 50,000-square-foot mixed use development at 419 Locust Street that currently includes 272 units of student housing — is adding Marco’s Pizza, Tim Hortons, a Sprint retail store and a bank.</p><p>“The final stage is important because we’ll be building the outlots that sit along Locust, which will serve as the front door to the whole project,” said Josh Rothstein, of Blue Ash-based OnSite Retail Group, which is handling marketing and leasing for the project. “The retailers and restaurants are excited to open their locations here because being across from Kroger, TJ Maxx and Dollar Tree provides tremendous exposure, great visibility and easy access to the shoppers already passing through this part of town.</p><p>“It’s also easily in walking distance to not only the concentration of Miami’s campus, but also the off-campus housing population,” Rothstein said.</p><p>Two other storefronts on the site are being are in the process of being leased, he said.</p><p>Existing Bishop Square tenants include Oxford Lane Library, Mercy Health - Orthopaedics and Sports Rehabilitation, Great Clips and Cloud 9 Vapor Lounge. A second-floor above some of those tenants includes office space.</p><p>Alan Kyger, Oxford’s economic development director, said the community is excited to see the Bishop Square project moving into its final phases.</p><p>“In 2005, when Walmart moved away from this site, the abandoned building that was left behind was a large eyesore for the Tollgate Business District, as well as for the whole community,” Kyger said. “Developer Robert Fiorita is to be commended in providing such a good-looking redevelopment project.</p><p>“The addition of these merchants will provide the citizens of Oxford additional shopping options. I expect each of these new businesses to be very successful in this new development.”</p><p>Marco’s Pizza has 700 stores in 35 states, doubling in size over the last five years and on track to 1,000 stores by the end of 2017, according to the company. Area locations include Middletown, Monroe, Hamilton and Liberty Twp. in Butler County.</p><div class="clearfix ">Tim Hortons has more than 4,400 locations in the United States, Canada and the Middle East. Area locations include Monroe, Springboro and Maineville in Warren County.</div><div class="socialShareButtons" style="margin-top:10px;">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="New restaurants and retail shops are coming to a development on the former Walmart site in Oxford.Bishop Square — a 50,000-square-foot mixed use development at 419 Locust Street that currently includes 272 units of student housing — is adding Marco’s Pizza, Tim Hortons, a Sprint retail store and a bank." data-janrain-title="New restaurants, retail shops coming to Oxford " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/new-restaurants-retail-shops-coming-oxford/O2c2TxfjLOdrYELXvfOUtM/"></div>
</div>

<div class="object-well" data-canonicalurl="http://www.whio.com/news/local/crash-victim-lived-fly-friend-says/uUNxNvSpaiUMvmdSjgqXcL/" id="o-21272365153">
<h1 class="headline">
            Crash victim lived to fly, friend says
         </h1>
<p>
<strong>Published: </strong>Saturday, June 09, 2012 @ 8:16 AM<br/>
<strong>Updated: </strong>Saturday, June 09, 2012 @ 8:16 AM<br/>
<span class="bylines">
<strong>By: </strong>

					www.whiotv.com</span>
</p>
<div class="lead-image-container">
<!-- don't show anything -->
</div>
<div class="socialShareButtons">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="A 73-year-old Bellbook man killed in a plane crash Saturday morning was an experienced pilot who had built four planes like the “experimental aircraft” he flew that day, according to his wife." data-janrain-title="Crash victim lived to fly, friend says " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/crash-victim-lived-fly-friend-says/uUNxNvSpaiUMvmdSjgqXcL/"></div>
</div>
<div class="article-container">
<!-- ARTICLE TEXT -->
<p><span class="article-dateline">
<span class="date-line-city">SPRING VALLEY TWP., Ohio</span>
</span>
<span> — </span>A 73-year-old Bellbook man killed in a plane crash Saturday morning was an experienced pilot who had built four planes like the “experimental aircraft” he flew that day, according to his wife.</p> <p>Roger Flower died in the 8 a.m. crash, said Sgt. Anthony Pearcy of the Ohio State Highway Patrol.</p> <p>“Some witnesses in the area did see the plane flying and the witnesses believe they did see something fall off the plane,” he said.</p> <p>Flying out of the Lewis A. Jackson Regional Airport in Greene County, the plane flown by Flower crashed about 100 yards from a house at 1856 Ohio 380. Debris from the crash spread about 300 feet and the plane had extensive damage.</p> <p>Flower was a naval aviator for 31 years who still loved to fly in his retirement, said Jan Flower, his wife of 50 years.</p> <p>“It was his life, ” she said. “He was flying a plane that he had built and flew out of Greene County Airport and was there every day and loved it.”</p> <p>After retiring from the Navy, he became a certified aviation engineer and began building his own aircraft, his wife said.</p> <p>“He knew what he was doing about building it and just loved it and wasn’t ready to give up airplanes, so he built them,” she said.</p> <p>Both natives of Ohio, Roger and Jan Flower have four sons and moved to Bellbrook eight years ago, when they were done traveling with the Navy.</p> <p>She described her husband as “a leader, totally confident. (He) could tackle anything, could build or fix anything, loved his children and his grandchildren, (and) loved serving in his church.”</p> <p>The OHSP is investigating the crash with the National Transportation Safety Board and the Greene County Sheriff’s Office.</p> <p>The plane was a fixed wing, single engine, experimental/homemade aircraft, according to the patrol.</p> <p>“According to the family members, it’s been flown before,” said Pearcy.</p> <p>There was no flight plan filed for the plane and the destination of the flight was unknown, Pearcy said.</p> <div class="clearfix ">“As unfortunate as this incident is, it is fortunate that no other people were involved,” Pearcy said.</div><div class="socialShareButtons" style="margin-top:10px;">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="A 73-year-old Bellbook man killed in a plane crash Saturday morning was an experienced pilot who had built four planes like the “experimental aircraft” he flew that day, according to his wife." data-janrain-title="Crash victim lived to fly, friend says " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/crash-victim-lived-fly-friend-says/uUNxNvSpaiUMvmdSjgqXcL/"></div>
</div>

<div class="object-well" data-canonicalurl="http://www.whio.com/news/local/arrest-made-slaying-businessman/5RVDnP0OiuWmckLdcFFQsM/" id="o-21278736243">
<h1 class="headline">
            Arrest made in slaying of businessman
         </h1>
<p>
<strong>Published: </strong>Wednesday, April 11, 2012 @ 7:44 PM<br/>
<strong>Updated: </strong>Wednesday, April 11, 2012 @ 7:44 PM<br/>
<span class="bylines">
<strong>By: </strong>

					































	
		
	
	
	
Katie Wedell		
					-
					Staff Writer</span>
</p>
<div class="lead-image-container">
<!-- don't show anything -->
</div>
<div class="socialShareButtons">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="Police have arrested a 20-year-old Dayton man in the slaying of a business owner found dead inside a burned out garage last week." data-janrain-title="Arrest made in slaying of businessman " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/arrest-made-slaying-businessman/5RVDnP0OiuWmckLdcFFQsM/"></div>
</div>
<div class="article-container">
<!-- ARTICLE TEXT -->
<p><span class="article-dateline">
<span class="date-line-city">DAYTON</span>
</span>
<span> — </span>Police have arrested a 20-year-old Dayton man in the slaying of a business owner found dead inside a burned out garage last week.</p> <p>Anthony Lamar Stargell Jr. was arrested Wednesday morning and is in the Montgomery County Jail pending the filing of an unclassified felony murder charge.</p> <p>Dayton Sgt. Dan Mauch said detectives believe Stargell shot and killed 54-year-old Tommy Nickles before setting a fire inside 838 S. Main St. on April 3.</p> <p>“The fire did not do the damage that the perpetrator expected,” Mauch said Wednesday afternoon. He said evidence collected inside the business and from Nickles’ stolen work van helped lead detectives to Stargell. The van was recovered by police late April 3 in the 400 block of Leland Avenue.</p> <p>A search warrant was executed at 2905 Oakridge Drive on Wednesday, where Stargell occasionally stays with family. He was taken into custody at about 11 a.m.</p> <p>Nickles, of Kettering, died from multiple gunshot wounds and was found in a garage where he ran Quality One Electrical Service. A Golden retriever that had been shot to death also was found in the building, police said.</p> <p>Nickles' family confirmed last week that he had been living in the building because of a recent divorce. They said they couldn’t fathom why someone would want to kill the father of two. </p> <p>“Tom was a good man, he was a good father,” said Gavin Whitt, Nickles’ godson.</p> <p>Mauch said Stargell and Nickles knew each other. He said police are investigating robbery as a possible motive or that Nickles possibly owed Stargell money.</p> <p>“It’s still an ongoing investigation,” he said. Police also are trying to locate several individuals who may have stolen property belonging to Nickles.</p> <p>According to court records, Stargell was convicted of robbery in February 2011 and sentenced to five years’ probation.</p> <p>His mother, Tonya Bailey, said her son recently got out of prison, but she doesn’t believe that he is responsible for Nickles’ death.</p> <p>“I don’t think that he did do it, but if he did do it he didn’t do it by himself,” she said.</p> <div class="clearfix ">She said Stargell wasn’t on South Main Street on the night Nickles was killed. “He was here,” she said at her mother’s house on Wednesday.</div><div class="socialShareButtons" style="margin-top:10px;">
<div align="left" class="janrainSocialPlaceholder" data-janrain-description="Police have arrested a 20-year-old Dayton man in the slaying of a business owner found dead inside a burned out garage last week." data-janrain-title="Arrest made in slaying of businessman " data-janrain-url="http://www.whio.com/news/local/arrest-made-slaying-businessman/5RVDnP0OiuWmckLdcFFQsM/"></div>
</div>

		function janrainSocialInit(){
		
			janrain.settings.social = {

			        "native-googleplus",
			        "email-googleplus",

			    ],

			    formFactor: "bar",
			    shareCountMode: "none"
			};

if(!window.janrainSocialDeferInit){
	janrainSocialInit();
}

// Idempotency, and we want to make sure this can be included in any order.
// This is pure javascript, no dependencies (e.g. jQuery) necessary.
// Get or initialize namespaces.
window.janrain = window.janrain || {};
janrain.settings = janrain.settings || {};
janrain.settings.capture = janrain.settings.capture || {};

);

var _janrainSocialOnLoadLoaded = false;
function janrainSocialOnLoad() {
	
	if(!_janrainSocialOnLoadLoaded){
		_janrainSocialOnLoadLoaded = true;

					janrain.cmg.monitorTweetShares();

			},

		});	
		pubsub.publish('authn-social-load');
	} 
}

</script>

<p>CHARLESTON, W.Va. -- McDowell County Public Service District has issued a boil-water advisory for customers in the Newhall and Cucumber areas. Customers in those areas should boil their water for at least one full minute prior to use until further notice. Meanwhile, Eastern Wyoming Public Service District has lifted a boil-water advisory for customers from 711 Moran Ave. to Townridge Acres in Mullens</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-608361">

<script src="https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/harrisondaily.com/shared-content/art/tncms/templates/libraries/flex/components/plugins/resources/scripts/jquery.calendario.7b513d925fce875220017f8d5a8055a0.js"></script>
<script>/*<![CDATA[*/ jQuery(document).ready(function($){
        var aChecked = [],
            urlParams = '/search/?l=25&unrolled=1&s=start_time&sd=asc&f=html',

            $wrapper = $( '#block-1484449 .fc-inner' ),
            $calendar = $( '#calendar-1484449' ),
            cal = $calendar.calendario({
                displayWeekAbbr: true,
                startIn: 0,
                onDayClick: function( $el, $contentEl, dateProperties ) {
                    window.location = $('#block-1484449 .url-template').attr('href') + urlParams + '&d1=' + $el.find('.fc-date').data('date') + '&d2=' + $el.find('.fc-date').data('date');
                }
            }),
            $month = $( '#block-1484449 .fc-month' ).html( cal.getMonthName() ),
            $year = $( '#block-1484449 .fc-year' ).html( cal.getYear() );


        $('#block-1484449 .fc-next').on('click', function() {
            cal.gotoNextMonth(updateMonthYear);
        });
        $('#block-1484449 .fc-prev').on('click', function() {
            cal.gotoPreviousMonth(updateMonthYear);
        });
        function updateMonthYear(){
            $month.html(cal.getMonthName());
            $year.html(cal.getYear());
            fetchDays();
        }
        function fetchDays(){
            if( aChecked.indexOf(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth()) == -1 ){
                $.ajax({
                    type: 'GET',
                    dataType: 'json',
                    url: $('#block-1484449 .url-template').attr('href') + '/search/?year='+cal.getYear()+'&month='+cal.getMonth()+'&fmt=json',
                    cache: true,
                    success: function(data) {
                        $.each(data, function(index, value){
                            if(value.result.numEvents > 0){
                                sMonth = value.result.month.toString();
                                if(sMonth.length < 2){ sMonth = '0'+sMonth }
                                sDay = value.result.day.toString();
                                if(sDay.length < 2){ sDay = '0'+sDay }
                                sString = sMonth + '-' + sDay + '-' + value.result.year;

                                oNumEvents = {};

                                var iOneDot = 1,
                                    iTwoDots = 2,
                                    iThreeDots = 3;

                                oNumEvents[sString] = '<div class="fc-data-item">';
                                if( value.result.numEvents > 0 && value.result.numEvents < iOneDot+1 ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> ';
                                }else if( value.result.numEvents > iOneDot && value.result.numEvents < iTwoDots+1 ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i>';
                                }else if( value.result.numEvents > iTwoDots ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i>';
                                }
                                oNumEvents[sString] += '</div>';

                                cal.setData(oNumEvents);
                            }
                        });

                        if( aChecked.indexOf(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth()) == -1 ){
                            aChecked.push(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth());
                        }
                    },
                    error: function(response) {
                        __tnt.log(response.status);
                    }
                });
            }
        }
        fetchDays();
    }); /*]]>*/</script>

    Boil water advisory lifted for JC

    by Teresa Snow

    Boil water advisory lifed for JC customers.

    Thu, 25 Oct 2012 02:19:22 GMT — 

    A boil water advisory in effect since Tuesday for Jefferson City resients has been lifted. At 9pm Wednesday Missouri American Water released a statement saying testing from 8 sites came back meeting EPA standards. Customers can feel safe using their water for cooking and drinking.

    The boil advisory came after a 6 inch water main broke Tuesday leaving thousands of customers without water for hours. The pipe was repaired but as the system was flushed customers were advised to boil any water used for cooking or drinking. Missouri American says it will notify customers Thursday morning with automated phone calls.

Boil water advisory issued for parts of E. Feliciana Parish

By Amber Stegall, Digital Content Manager
Email
Connect
astegall@wafb.com
Follow @amberstegall
EAST FELICIANA PARISH, LA (WAFB) -

A boil-water advisory has been issued for parts of East Feliciana Parish until Tuesday due to some maintenance related issues that occurred on Friday.

Water District #7 in East Feliciana Parish says all of the homes and business on Hurst Lane and on Highway 432 should boil their water before consumption.

During a boil water advisory, do not consume tap water that has not been disinfected, ice or drinks made from tap water that has not been disinfected, or raw foods rinsed with tap water that has not been disinfected.

Disinfect water by boiling at a rolling boil for 1 minute. A safe alternative source of potable water includes bottled, treated or distilled water.

It is okay to wash clothes.

Provide pets with boiled water after it is cooled.

Posted October 24, 2012 05:19 pm | Updated October 24, 2012 05:27 pm
By
Dan Scanlan

Boil water advisory issued for Lawtey municipal water customers

The city of Lawtey has issued a boil water advisory for all customers in its municipal water system due to a loss of pressure from a water main break. The advisory is in effect until the problem is resolved and a bacteriological survey shows the water is safe to drink.

Any water used for drinking or cooking must be boiled for one minute in a rolling boil. Bottled water may also be used. This does not affect wells. Questions - call the city of Lawtey at (904) 782-3454.

City of Goliad issues notice to boil water

Oct. 11, 2012 at 5:11 a.m.
Updated Oct. 12, 2012 at 5:12 a.m.

Because of a loss of pressure in a water well in Goliad, the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality is requiring the city of Goliad to issue a boil water notice to its residents.

To ensure destruction of all harmful bacteria and other microbes, water for drinking, cooking and making ice should be boiled and cooled before its use.

The water should be brought to a boil for two minutes.

In lieu of boiling, residents may purchase bottled water or obtain water from some other suitable source.

When it is no longer necessary to boil the water, city officials will notify residents that the water is safe for consumption.

Instructions to discontinue boiling will be issued in the same manner as this notice.

Residents with questions may contact Larry Zermeno at 361-645-3454 or Cindy Shilinga at 361-645-9606 or the TCEQ at 512-239-4691.

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>KINGSBURY -- A boil-water notice was issued for the entire town of Kingsbury on Thursday after state officials found “disease causing” organisms in the system.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>The Hudson Falls village water system is separate and unaffected.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/poststar.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The state Department of Health urges all town residents connected to the town's system to use bottled water or bring any tap water to a rolling boil for at least a minute before consumption.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Town Supervisor Jim Lindsay said trace amounts of E. coli bacteria were found during a routine town water test.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/poststar.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1420333"></div></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/poststar.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>Lindsay said a second round of testing was conducted Thursday afternoon, but the results haven’t yet returned.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>A system must pass two consecutive tests before being cleared for regular use, under state health law.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Another test of the system is scheduled for Friday morning, Lindsay said.</p>
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1420330"></div></div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="comment-text">
<p>The village of Hudson Falls is in the Town of Kingsbury, so does this apply for Hudson Falls too??</p>
</div>
<div class="comment-options text-right pull-right hidden-print">

<div class="media comment" data-comment-uuid="a34631e6-13de-11e2-87cc-101f742c2de4" data-user="dot2dot" id="comment-a34631e6-13de-11e2-87cc-101f742c2de4">
<div class="comment-body media-body">
<div class="comment-user">
<a class="hidden-print" href="https://poststar.com/users/profile/dot2dot">
<div class="avatar img-responsive" title="dot2dot">
<i class="fa fa-fw fa-user"></i>
</div>

</div>
<div class="comment-heading media-heading">
<strong class="username visible-xs-block visible-sm-inline visible-md-inline visible-lg-inline"><a href="https://poststar.com/users/profile/dot2dot">dot2dot</a></strong>
<time class="timestamp visible-xs-block visible-sm-inline visible-md-inline visible-lg-inline" datetime="1349985771" pubdate="">Oct 11, 2012 4:02pm</time>
</div>
<div class="comment-text">
<p>Anyone else confused as to how HF and Kingsbury have separate water systems?  I know of no Kingsbury water storage or treatment plant so where does their water come from? Last I knew (or thought I knew) HF bought water from Queensbury, marked it up, and then resold to HF residents. I assumed Kingsbury residents with water service bought it from Hudson Falls. Learn something new everyday...</p>
</div>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">
<div data-next-url="http://poststar.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=3b4d516a-13d3-11e2-85b0-001a4bcf887a&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube" id="infinite-more">
<i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i>
</div>
</div>
<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://poststar.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=3b4d516a-13d3-11e2-85b0-001a4bcf887a&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != '3b4d516a-13d3-11e2-85b0-001a4bcf887a') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://poststar.com/tncms/block/1421721/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

</div>
<p>CHARLESTON, W.Va. -- West Virginia American Water has lifted a boil-water advisory for about 300 customers in the Salt Rock area. The advisory was issued for Raccoon Creek, Beech Fork Road, Bowen Creek Road, Brinnager Road, Fire Tower Road, Nicely Road, Grassy Lick Road and Goodman Branch Road and part of Lavalette Public Service District following a water main break.McDowell County Public Service District has lifted the boil-water advisory issued Oct. 11 for the Newhall area.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-608361">

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });

Boil Water Advisory For New Bern Neighborhood Lifted

Posted: Thu 11:14 AM, Oct 11, 2012 &nbsp|&nbsp
Updated: Fri 11:02 AM, Oct 12, 2012

New Bern says a water main break has been repaired for one part of the city.

Those people who lived on Midyette Avenue, Powell Street, Pinecrest Avenue, Richard Court, Christian Court, Karen Street, Taylor Street, Delsea Court, and the Pinecrest Mobile Home Park residents were under a boil water advisory because of the leak.

The city says testing now shows the water is safe to drink.

Previous Story

Residents of several streets in New Bern are being told to boil their water after a water main break in the city.

Those who live on Midyette Avenue, Powell Street, Pinecrest Avenue, Richard Court, Christian Court, Karen Street, Taylor Street, Delsea Court, and the Pinecrest Mobile Home Park may already have low water pressure because of the break. Those residents are also being told to boil all water for human consumption for one minute or use bottled water.

After the repair is fixed the city will have to perform tests to make sure the water is okay to drink.

<img alt="HAWES: Waging war against the evil news media" class="img-responsive lazyload full" data-sizes="auto" data-srcset="https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/richmondregister.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/7/f9/7f91b5d3-e09a-516f-904b-5667f08e3834/5a09fd587f1ca.image.jpg?resize=200%2C138 200w, https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/richmondregister.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/7/f9/7f91b5d3-e09a-516f-904b-5667f08e3834/5a09fd587f1ca.image.jpg?resize=300%2C206 300w, https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/richmondregister.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/7/f9/7f91b5d3-e09a-516f-904b-5667f08e3834/5a09fd587f1ca.image.jpg 400w" height="220" src="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAEAAAABCAQAAAC1HAwCAAAAC0lEQVR42mM8Uw8AAh0BTZud3BwAAAAASUVORK5CYII=" width="320"/>

<div class="card-body">
<div class="card-headline">
<h3 class="">
<a href="/opinion/hawes-waging-war-against-the-evil-news-media/article_8ac9887c-d9ed-11e7-b54b-9358b0889da4.html">
        

        
        HAWES: Waging war against the evil news media</a></h3>
</div>
<div class="card-lead">
<p>In this era where facts are called lies and lies masquerade as facts, it probably shouldn’t be surprising that the organization behind an effort to plant a fake news story would be called Project Veritas. </p>
</div>

<p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Richmond Utilities has lifted the 24-hour boil-water advisory in parts of downtown Richmond following work on the area's water main.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">The boil water advisory had been issued at 7:30 p.m. Tuesday for Woodland Avenue, Glyndon Avenue and Moberly Avenue between Third and Fifth streets.</p>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset, atf","fold":"above","include_domain":"cnhi\/richmondregister","size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com\/richmondregister.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/archives"}' style="display:none;"></div>

Howeverr the work went longer than expected into Wednesday afternoon.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Lonnie Banks, water quality specialist, said the boil-water advisory is a routine measure that is taken anytime water pipes are exposed to the air. Water samples were taken and tested before the advisory was lifted.</p>

            if (

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 30;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 30) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 30);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });

Boil order issued on Route 78

Wednesday
Oct 10, 2012 at 3:53 PM Oct 10, 2012 at 3:54 PM

Boil order south of Kewanee on Route 78

Mike Landis

Effective Wednesday, water was shut off and a boil order issued for Route 78 south of Kewanee.  
The Water Department will be replacing a fire hydrant.  
Areas affected include Advanced Metal Working, Townsedge Apartments, Tumbleson Automotive, Sandbur Western Wear and the two houses south.
Residents in these areas may experience low pressure, rusty water, or no water.  Residents should take precautions when using their water until the water runs clean.  
Do not run hot water as doing this will draw rust into the water heater.  Only flush your system by running the cold water.  If your service is shut off during this repair, you will be under a boil order for 48-72 hours following the restoration of water service.
If you have any questions, please call City Hall at 852-2611.

‘Boil water advisory’ lifted for some Jefferson residents

JacksonHeraldTODAY

RSS Feed Email Alerts Twitter Facebook
  • Commerce News
  • Braselton News
  • Classifieds
  • Public Notices
  • Online Edition
  • Ga. Weekly Newspaper Museum

‘Boil water advisory’ lifted for some Jefferson residents

Monday, October 22. 2012
A “boil water” advisory for Jefferson residents impacted by the water repairs made last week has been lifted and the water is now safe to drink.

“We have received the required bacteriological test results which indicate that the water is again safe to drink,” Jeff Killip, public works director said. “No boiling is necessary.”

There was a water service interruption in some areas of Jefferson Friday while repairs to the line were being made. The areas impacted included: Water Plant, Clay Drive, Cooley Avenue and College Street from East Minden (the square) to Institute Street. The repair was made to the existing 14-inch water main.

Boil Water Alert Lifted For Margate, Coconut Creek

October 20, 2012 at 7:00 pm
Filed Under:Bacteriological Testing, Broward County Health Department, Coconut Creek, Coconut Creek Parkway, Margate, Reddy Chitepu, Water Samples, Water Testing

MARGATE (CBSMiami) — The boil water alert for all of Margate and those in Coconut Creek south of the Coconut Creek Parkway was lifted early Saturday evening.

The advisory was lifted after bacteria testing samples showed the water is safe to drink. Still, the Broward County Health Department suggests residents allow water to run for five minutes at each tap to flush the lines with safe water. The agency also recommends discarding the first batch of ice from ice bins.

The City of Margate ordered the boil water notice on Friday when one of the samples from the city’s wells tested positive for fecal indicators.

The well was immediately removed from service and shut off. The boil water alert was lifted as a result of two consecutive days of samples collected for bacteriological testing returned negative.

For more information, please visit the city’s website at www.margatefl.com or the Broward County Health Department’s website at http://browardchd.org/. You may also contact Reddy Chitepu, P.E., Director, at (954) 972-0828.

ROYAL PALM BEACH, FL (WFLX) - A water main break is causing quite a mess along Sandpiper Avenue in Royal Palm Beach.

We're told there was so much pressure, a mailbox shot right out of the ground and 15-feet into the air. Crews have been working overnight to cut the water off.

A water boil advisory is now in effect for the surrounding neighborhood.

Water service interruption planned in some areas of Jefferson

JacksonHeraldTODAY

RSS Feed Email Alerts Twitter Facebook

Water service interruption planned in some areas of Jefferson

Friday, October 19. 2012
There will be a water service interruption some areas of Jefferson today (Friday) while repairs to the line are being made.
The areas to be impacted include: Water Plant, Clay Drive, Cooley Avenue and College Street from East Minden (the square) to Institute Street.

The interruption is to the existing 14-inch water main which has only a few services off it.

“Not all customers will be affected,” Jeff Killip, public works director said. “Those that are will be notified by water department staff, they will also notify any affected businesses before work commences.”

A “Boil Water” advisory will be in effect for those incurring the service interruption. This advisory will be lifted once the repairs have been made and bacteriological lab tests have been performed. Results from lab may not be returned until Monday.

“We will notify those affected as soon as the results are received,” Killip said.

The work will begin at 9:30 a.m. and will take approximately four-hours to complete.

visible-xs-inline-block" data-disqus-identifier="13247323">0</span></a></div></div>
<div class="content-main-image">
<img alt="Update: Precautionary Water Boiled Issued For Portion Of Siesta Key" class="img-responsive center-block" src="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/975664/2012/10/T800x600/c022e8df54b3c69fbc7930ad9cb2ae4c.jpg"/> </div>
<div class="content-body center-block" id="article-wrapper">
<p><strong>Update: </strong>Water service has been restored to Siesta Key water customers near Stickney Point Road, and a precautionary boil advisory has been issued.</p> <p>Water should be brought to a rolling boil for one minute.</p> <p><strong>Earlier: </strong>A Siesta Key water main break is causing several businesses and nearly 2,500 customers to have their water service interrupted today.</p> <p>The break occurred Thursday afternoon at 6619 Stickney Point Road, and will continue to cause water service outages for the next four to six hours, according to the county. </p> <p>All businesses south of the Stickney Point bridge are being affected by the interruption, according to the county, and 2,467 customers are being impacted.</p> <p>A turn lane on the bridge is being used for southbound traffic due to the break. </p> <p>A precautionary boil advisory has been issued, though officials don't believe drinking water was contaminated. Water should be brought to a rolling boil for one minute. Boiling the tap water disinfects it, destroying harmful microorganisms. Bottled water can be used as an alternative to boiling tap water. </p> <p>Water customers in the affected area will be notified by another automated telephone call when the boil water advisory is canceled.</p><div id="in-article-boxed-recirc"><div class="text-center air-md"><a category="subscribe" class="btn btn-lg btn-cta-alt pill sans in-article-subscribe l-bold" href="/" trigger="article_button_click">   Subscribe  <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-angle-right fa-lg"></span></a></div></div> </div>

Boil Water Order Issued For Margate, Parts Of Coconut Creek

October 18, 2012 at 10:34 pm
Filed Under:Boil Water Notice, Boil Water Order, Bottled Water, Coconut Creek, Fecal Matter, Margate
(Source: AP Photo/Keith Srakocic)

MARGATE (CBS4) – Officials in Margate and Coconut Creek are warning their residents to boil their drinking water after well water tests came back positive for traces of fecal matter.

The well in question has been removed from service and further tests will be performed to determine when the well water will be safe to drink.

Click Here to see a map of the affected areas.

City officials recommend bringing water to a rolling boil, then continue to boil the water for one minute, before cooling and drinking. Officials are encouraging residents to use boiled or bottled water for drinking, making ice, preparing food, and washing dishes until tests on the contaminated water show levels have returned to normal.

For more information and updates, visit Margate’s website at http://www.margatefl.com or the Broward County Health Department’s website at http://browardchd.org/. You may also contact Reddy Chitepu, P.E., Director, at (954) 972-0828 or Jerry A. Blough, City Manager, at (954) 935-5300.

                        if( serviceID != 0 ){

                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }

                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>DAKOTA CITY, Neb. | Dakota County Rural Water customers are being asked to boil water following a main break, officials said Thursday.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>Customers should bring all tap water to a rolling boil for one minute. Boiled water should be used for drinking, ice, washing dishes, brushing teeth and food preparation until further notice.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/siouxcityjournal.com/news/local/briefs" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Water Superintendent Lance Olerich said the break happened Wednesday morning near the system’s water tower on E. Avenue in Dakota City.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/siouxcityjournal.com/news/local/briefs" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>Officials are testing water. Customers will be notified when it's no longer necessary to boil water.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/siouxcityjournal.com/news/local/briefs" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Call 402-987-3402 for more information.</p>
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>
</div>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>
